ques_content: 题目内容: Mr. Green and Mrs. Green come to China from England. They have two children. Their son is Jim. He is fifteen years old. Kate is Jim’s sister. She is thirteen. Mr. Green works in No.5 Middle School. Jim and Kate study in their father’s school, but they are in different grades. Jim is in Grade Eight, and Kate is in Grade Seven. Jim and I are in the same class. Kate goes to school with us every day. They are my good friends. They like China very much. (1) 题目内容: The Green family lives in __ now. 选项: A. America B. England C. China  (2) 题目内容: Mr. Green has __ children. 选项: A. two B. three C. four  (3) 题目内容: The underlined word “different” means “__” in Chinese. 选项: A. 相同的 B. 不同的 C. 很好的  (4) 题目内容: Jim, Kate and I are __. 选项: A. friends B. classmates C. Mr. Green’s children  (5) 题目内容: Mr. Green is probably a __. 选项: A. teacher B. doctor C. worker
ques_analyze:
【分析】短文介绍了格林一家在中国的生活。他们从英国来到中国生活，格林先生是教师，格林夫妇有两个孩子在同一所学校上学，但年级不同，作者和他们是好朋友。
(1) 格林一家现在住在中国，因为文中提到“格林先生和格林夫人从英国来到中国”，正确答案为C。
(2) 根据“They have two children”可知，格林先生有两个孩子，正确答案为A。
(3) 由“吉姆在八年级，凯特在七年级”，可以判断“不同”在中文中是“不同的”，正确答案为B。
(4) 由“他们是我的好朋友”和“凯特每天和我们一起上学”可以看出，吉姆、凯特和我是朋友，正确答案为A。
(5) 从“格林先生在第五中学工作”可以推测出格林先生可能是一名教师，正确答案为A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: It seems that food deliverymen are always in haste. We can see them running every minute, and they seem to have lots of things to do the next minute. They wear blue, red or yellow helmets, and many of them don’t follow traffic rules. They drive on the wrong side of the road, run red lights, and use mobile phones when they are driving. However, not everything goes well with food deliverymen. In the first half of 2017, there were 76 traffic accidents involving food deliverymen in Shanghai. This means every two and a half days, a food deliveryman will die or get hurt on the road. What makes deliverymen so dangerous? The strict rules of the food delivery companies and the worried customers may be the answer. According to China Daily, many companies will fine a deliveryman up to 2,000 yuan if he can’t deliver the food on time. Fines also go to those who get bad words from customers. To make sure that deliverymen drive safely, many cities in China asked companies to train their deliverymen on traffic rules and safety. Now in Shenzhen, if a deliveryman breaks traffic rules more than twice, then he cannot drive to send food for a whole year. (1) 题目内容: The underlined phrase “in haste” means __. 选项: A. 意外地 B. 慢慢地 C. 饥饿地 D. 匆忙地 (2) 题目内容: The first paragraph mainly tells us that many food deliverymen __. 选项: A. use mobile phones B. break traffic rules C. don’t wear right clothes D. are good at driving (3) 题目内容: How many traffic accidents may food deliverymen in Shanghai cause in the whole year of 2017? 选项: A. 38 B. 76 C. 152 D. 250 (4) 题目内容: Which of the following is True according to the passage? 选项: A. Many companies won’t punish a deliveryman even if he can’t arrive on time. B. It is very common that a food deliveryman die or get hurt on the road C. They drive on the wrong side of the road and stop at red lights. D. If a deliveryman breaks traffic rules, then he cannot work for a whole year. (5) 题目内容: According to the last paragraph, we will know that __. 选项: A. Shenzhen is the best place for deliverymen B. all the companies in China train their deliverymen on traffic rules and safety C. some cities are trying to help deliverymen follow traffic rules D. food deliverymen cannot drive in Shenzhen now
ques_analyze: 本文是一篇说明文，主要描述了食品外送员工作急促，经常不遵守交通规则，导致了许多交通事故的情况。现在，为了确保外送员安全驾驶，一些城市要求外送公司对他们进行交通规则和安全方面的培训，并设定了相关制度减少交通规则违反的行为。(1) 词句猜测题。从句子'我们可以看到他们每一分钟都在奔跑，似乎下一分钟又有很多事情要做。' 可以推测，'匆匆忙忙的'指的是外送员们总是急忙地忙碌着，因此选择D项'匆忙地'最为合适。(2) 主旨大意题。第一段指出他们'...很多人不遵守交通规则。'，这表明主要描述的是许多外送员违反交通规则的情况，故选B项。(3) 细节理解题。第二段提到'...上海发生了76起涉及食品外送员的交通事故。' 是说仅在2017年上半年就有76起交通事故，如果按照这个比例估算，全年则可能有152起，因此C项正确。(4) 细节理解题。从'这意味着每两天半就会有一名外送员在路上死亡或受伤。' 可以看出外送员在路上受伤或死亡的情况相对较为常见，因此选择B项。(5) 细节理解题。文章最后一段说明'...许多城市要求公司对外送员进行交通规则和安全培训。' 这表明一些中国城市正试图帮助外送员遵守交通规则，所以正确答案为C项。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Although most of us are now stuck at home due to the virus outbreak, there are still many people trying to do some creative things not only to kill time, but also to help themselves and others stay positive during this difficult period. In their own ways, they are showing others that they won’t let the virus get them down. Take a look at some of the interesting things they’re doing with their spare time. Encourage people to dance Matthew Lee is a 16-year-old Chinese-American who is now living in Los Angeles, US. When he learned that most Chinese are unable to leave their houses, he and Jojo decided to encourage them to work out at home by making a dance video with their friends. They were very excited about the opportunity to lift Chinese people’s spirits. In the cool-down part of the dance, Lee chose to dance to the song We Are The World. Lee said, “I believe that with sweat and smiles, together, we will make a better day.” Write a rap song “I close my eyes and pray hoping everything will be okay/the one who can save you is not God/but an ordinary man in flesh and blood.” These are a few lines from a rap song written by Liu Yixin and Li Yusheng who are Senior 3 students in Beijing. Titled An Empty City, the song became a hit as soon as it was released because of its thought-provoking lyrics and deep emotion. People have not only been amazed by the talent of these young teenagers, but also touched by their strong sense of social responsibility. Write an English poem Du Yiran is a Junior 2 student from Baoding, Hebei. While stuck at home during the outbreak, Du and her classmates wrote several acrostic poems in English to help cheer people up. She said: “I found it quite interesting, as you can hide a message in the first letters of each line and surprise your readers as they read downwards. As teenagers, we can’t go to the front line to save people’s lives, but we should learn to care about others and do something meaningful during this time.” 1. Why is the song An Empty City so popular? 选项: A. Because it was written by two students. B. Because it is about the current situation in Wuhan. C. Because it is the best way to express one’s opinions. D. Because it touches people’s hearts and makes them think. 2. How did Matthew Lee and Jojo encourage people to work out? 选项: A. They made a dance video with their friends. B. They were streaming live every day. C. They learned to dance from online videos. D. They sang the song We Are The World. 3. Du Yiran finds it interesting to write acrostic poems because__.. 选项: A. she is stuck at home with little entertainment. B. she can surprise readers with a hidden message. C. she has never written any acrostic poems before. D. she has learned to care about others through writing. 4. What is the story about? 选项: A. Creative indoors activities. B. Talented students around the world. C. Best ways to kill time at home. D. Useful tips for staying positive.
ques_analyze:
【分析】本文关注的是疫情期间寻找积极方式度过困难时刻的个人，通过他们的创造性活动，我们可以了解如何在困难时期保持积极心态。
(1) 细节理解题。《空城》之所以受欢迎，是因为它具有启发思考的歌词和深层次的情感，直接打动了人们的心灵，因此选项D是正确的。
(2) 细节理解题。马修·李和乔乔通过与朋友一起制作舞蹈视频来鼓励人们在家锻炼，选项A正确。
(3) 细节理解题。杜一然发现写藏头诗有趣是因为她可以在每行的第一个字母中隐藏信息，给读者惊喜，选项B揭示了这一点。
(4) 主旨大意题。文章讲述的是人们如何使用创造性活动来度过被困在家的时光，并通过这些活动帮助自己和他人保持积极态度，因此选项A最准确地概述了文章的主题。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Here is one of the world's largest indoor ski slopes. It covers an area of 22,500 m<sup>2</sup>, about the same size as three football fields, and the temperature is about -1℃ to -2℃. However, the strangest thing about this place is that it's in the middle of the desert! It's called Ski Dubai. It sounds crazy, but it just shows how serious people are about having fun. We spend huge sums on sports facilities. We pay our sports stars lots of money. And we spend hour after hour playing games! I wonder if all the sports lovers and game players in the world aren't a little crazy. I know I am. I was once driving past a football field where some kids were playing. I turned to watch and crashed my car. I know it's stupid but I can do nothing about it. As someone said, "Football isn't a matter of life and death. It's much more important than that!" Of course, it isn't that important really. No game is. But the problem is that games are addictive. From the tennis court to the golf course, you'll find participants and spectators who can't live without the drug of their choice. It could be a good thing. After all, it's really true that sports and games help us to relax. Maybe if it wasn't for sport, our societies would be more violent. Perhaps sport is a substitute for war? It's hard to think of a quieter, more peaceful game than chess, and what's the purpose? Getting control of your opponent's king. And surely, it's better to have wars in athletics stadiums rather than on battlefields. What's more, playing is natural. Little cats chase balls of wool and little dogs pretend to fight. Games help us perfect our skills and prepare us for the serious contest of survival. But do all games help us relax and stay away from violence? What about computer games? A recent article in New Scientist suggests that playing violent video games makes people more likely to commit violent crimes. Are these games a rehearsal for life or a substitute for life? Do we play instead of facing up to our real problems? I don't know. But what I do know is that I need a break. Something to help me relax. Skiing would be nice. I wonder how much it costs to get to Dubai. 根据短文内容选择最佳答案, 并将其标号填涂在答题卡相应位置。 (1) 题目内容: According to the author, the most surprising thing about Ski Dubai is its __.选项: A. slopes B. size C. location D. facilities  (2) 题目内容: What happened when the author turned to watch some kids playing football?选项: A. He joined them after parking the car. B. He drove past the football field directly. C. He became crazy and stupid about it. D. He had an accident with car damage.  (3) 题目内容: The expression “the drug of their choice” in the 3rd paragraph refers to __.选项: A. the game they are fond of B. the medicine they take C. the activity good for health D. the sport in place of war  (4) 题目内容: Which of the following statements does the writer most probably agree with?选项: A. Sports stars should be paid more to play well. B. Sports are more important than life and death. C. Chess is too peaceful to be considered a sport. D. Games can make one relaxed as well as violent.  (5) 题目内容: What does the writer mainly talk about in the passage?选项: A. The relationship between games and crimes. B. Human natural craze for having fun with games. C. Serious concerns about time that is spent on games. D. Real problems facing game players in everyday life.
ques_analyze: 本文通过描述位于沙漠中的滑雪坡——迪拜滑雪场引入讨论，探讨人们对运动游戏的热情。首先，作者惊讶于这个冰冷的地方居然出现在沙漠中心，对应答案C（位置）。然后，讲述自己因为观看孩子们踢足球而撞车的经历，说明对游戏的狂热，对应答案D（他的车发生了事故）。接着，作者将游戏比作“选择的毒品”，指向答案A（他们喜欢的游戏）。随后，作者讨论游戏的正反两面，认为游戏既能让人放松也能引发暴力，对应答案D（游戏既能让人放松也能引发暴力）。最后，文章核心在于探讨人类对娱乐游戏的自然追求，对应答案B（人类对游戏的自然狂热）。解析过程中，我们梳理了作者观点，并解释了文章中的关键句子和短语，以达到更好的理解。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: I’m Frank. Welcome to my classroom. You can see some desks and chairs in it. This is the blackboard. Above the blackboard are four great men’s pictures. On this wall is a map. On that wall are students’ pictures. This is the teacher’s desk. An eraser and a ruler are on it. Look at that desk. A lost and found box is on it. You can see some school things in the box—a red pencil, two blue erasers, a black pen and a radio. Who lost them? That is a bookcase. And some books are in it. The students can read them after class. Come here! This is my desk. My Chinese book, a notebook and a pen are on it, and my schoolbag is in it. (1) 题目内容: What’s above the blackboard? 选项: A. Some teachers’ pictures. B. Four great men’s pictures. C. Four students’ pictures. D. A map. (2) 题目内容: Where is the ruler? 选项: A. On Frank’s desk. B. On the teacher’s desk. C. In the teacher’s desk. D. In Frank’s desk. (3) 题目内容: What is NOT in the lost and found box? 选项: A. A radio. B. A black pen. C. A notebook. D. Two erasers. (4) 题目内容: Which is NOT true? 选项: A. Some students’ pictures are on the wall. B. An eraser is on the teacher’s desk. C. A bookcase is in the classroom. D. Frank’s notebook is in the schoolbag.
ques_analyze: 本文是弗兰克对自己教室及自己课桌的基本介绍。针对四个问题的解析如下：(1)根据文章中的描述“在黑板上方有四位伟人的照片。”，可以知道黑板上方是四幅伟人的照片，所以选项B正确；(2)再从句“这是老师的桌子，上面有一个橡皮和一把尺子。”中得知老师的桌子上有橡皮和尺子，因此选项B正确；(3)文章说明“一个失物招领箱。你可以在箱子里看到一些学校用品——一支红色的铅笔、两块蓝色的橡皮、一支黑色的钢笔和一台收音机。”，未提到笔记本，故选项C正确；(4)最后，由“这是我的桌子，上面有我的语文书、一个笔记本和一支笔，”可以判断，弗兰克的笔记本在桌子上，不在书包里，由此知道选项D是不正确的陈述。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: During ancient times, children didn’t have smart phones, iPads or computers. Therefore, they invented many interesting games. Let’s take a look at these games. Hide-and-seek Hide-and-seek is a traditional game for children, popular around the nation. There are two ways to play: one way is to cover a child’s eyes while other kids run around to tease him; the other, more common way is for children to hide and one child to try to find them. Firecrackers Firecrackers have a history of more than 2,000 years. It is said that in ancient China, there was a beast named Nian, and to scare it off, people burnt bamboo joints to make a blasting sound. After gunpowder was invented, it gradually replaced the bamboo joints. Nowadays, firecrackers are still set off during the Spring Festival. Playing diabolo Diabolo is usually made of wood or bamboo and is hollow in the center. By juggling the diabolo on ropes, the high-speed rotating diabolo will make a sound. Playing diabolo is a very interesting folk game, especially popular in North China, and it has a long history. Stone balls During the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911), kicking a stone ball around was a popular sport in the northern part of China, often played in the winter to keep warm. Stones were carved into small balls and kicked with feet. In 1999, the sport was included in the competition in the 6th National Ethnic Group Traditional Sports Meeting held in Beijing. (1) 题目内容: The way of playing hide-and-seek includes__. 选项: A. covering a child’s eyes while other kids tease him B. one child hides and others try to find him C. all children hide and try to find each other D. one child tries to find others who have hidden (2) 题目内容: The underlined word “blast” means__. 选项: A. bloom B. revelry C. explosion D. boil (3) 题目内容: The game__has something to do with one of the four ancient Chinese inventions. 选项: A. Hide-and-seek B. Firecrackers C. Playing diabolo D. Stone balls (4) 题目内容: The game Stone balls__. 选项: A. has the longest history of the four games B. was popular in the 18th century C. was invented in Guangzhou D. was played with hands (5) 题目内容: __are mainly played in North China. 选项: A. Playing diabolo and Stone balls B. Stone balls and Firecrackers C. Hide-and-seek and Stone balls D. Playing diabolo and Firecrackers
ques_analyze:
【分析】文章讲述了古代儿童没有智能手机、iPad或电脑，而是发明了一些有趣的游戏来玩。这些游戏包括捉迷藏、鞭炮、玩空竹和石头球。
(1) 细节理解题。文章描述了捉迷藏的两种玩法：一种是蒙住一个孩子的眼睛让其他孩子戏弄他，另一种更常见的方式是由一个孩子去找隐藏的其他孩子。因此，D项“一个孩子尝试找到藏起来的其他孩子”是正确的。
(2) 词义猜测题。为了吓跑“年兽”，人们烧竹节使它们“blast”。结合上下文可知，“blast”意思是“爆炸”，因此C项“爆炸”符合语境。
(3) 细节理解题。文章中提到火药，它是中国四大发明之一，逐渐取代了竹节。鞭炮与火药相关，因此B项“鞭炮”和四大发明有关系。
(4) 细节理解题。根据题干信息，石头球这种游戏在清朝时北方流行，所以B项“在18世纪流行”正确。
(5) 推理判断题。玩空竹和踢石球这两种游戏在中国北方尤其受欢迎。因此A项“玩空竹和石头球”是正确的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: No matter where a video game is played, on a handheld device, the Internet or the television, too much gaming is a bad thing. Playing too many video games is a problem for kids and there are many signs that show the negative influences. If young people are always thinking about when they can play a video game, that is a sign that they have lost themselves in it. If they give up other hobbies that they used to love, that is also a problem. Many kids who choose to spend all their free time playing video games will make up ways to play the game instead of communicating with others. Leaving sports teams or clubs, refusing to go outside to play with friends, and choosing to stay home from birthday parties are all signs that video games have taken over the child’s attention. In addition to negative behaviours, there are health problems from playing too many video games. If video game players skip meals or lose sleep because they stayed up too late playing games, this can negatively influence their health. Sitting in front of a game for more than two hours a day instead of getting up and being active can result in childhood obesity. Moreover, backaches, headaches and strained eyes can be caused by playing too many video games. (1) 题目内容: The writer thinks __ is a problem for kids that causes negative influences. 选项: A. 过多看电视 B. 购买太多掌上设备 C. 过多玩电子游戏 D. 在网上聊天过多 (2) 题目内容: If a child is crazy about video games, he or she may __. 选项: A. 总想着玩游戏 B. 比平时吃得更多 C. 喜欢和朋友举行聚会 D. 喜欢户外活动多过宅在家里 (3) 题目内容: What kind of problem will video game addiction cause according to the passage? 选项: A. 脚痛的几率增加 B. 对锻炼失去兴趣 C. 心跳速度减慢 D. 睡眠时间增加 (4) 题目内容: What is the main idea of the passage? 选项: A. 如何避免玩电子游戏 B. 电子游戏成瘾的迹象和危害 C. 停止制作电子游戏的原因 D. 儿童缺乏锻炼的后果 (5) 题目内容: You may find this passage in __. 选项: A. 报纸 B. 时尚杂志 C. 故事书 D. 指南书
ques_analyze: 【分析】这篇文章讨论了过度玩电子游戏对儿童的影响及其消极后果。首先，文章提到如果孩子总想着何时能玩游戏，说明他们已经沉迷于其中。其次，文章探讨了其他负面行为，例如放弃其他兴趣爱好，缺乏社交活动，以及因为游戏而不吃饭或睡眠不足。这些行为会影响孩子的健康，可能导致肥胖、背痛、头痛和眼睛疲劳等问题。根据文章内容，可以为每个问题选择正确选项：(1) C. 文章开头明确指出过度玩电子游戏对孩子有负面影响；(2) A. 如果孩子总想着何时能玩游戏，表明他们已经沉迷；(3) B. 文中提到孩子可能因为长时间坐着玩游戏而不愿意锻炼；(4) B. 整篇文章的核心是电子游戏成瘾的迹象和危害；(5) A. 考虑文章的内容，讨论这类话题的文章更可能出现在报纸上。点睛：本文通过分析电子游戏对孩子的负面影响，强调了成瘾的危害。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: I am Gina. I have a sister. Her name is Rina. We are in New York with our parents. I love my family. Gina I’m a boy from Beijing. I don’t have brothers or sisters, but I have a happy family. Wang Lei I’m an English girl. I have a brother. His name is Jack. I’m 13 and he is 15. My favorite color is green, but his favorite color is blue. Jack likes playing basketball with his classmates. Jenny I have a family of five. We are in London. I have two sisters. They are Amy and May. Amy has a pink pencil box and five pens. May has a green pencil box and six pencils. Betty 根据材料内容，从A、B、C三个选项中选出正确的答案。 (1) 题目内容: Where are Gina and her family? 选项: A. In London. B. In Beijing. C. In New York. (2) 题目内容: Does Wang Lei have sisters? 选项: A. Yes, he does. B. No, he doesn’t. C. Sorry, I don’t know. (3) 题目内容: Who does Jack like playing basketball with? 选项: A. His classmates. B. His sister. C. His brothers. (4) 题目内容: How many pencils does May have? 选项: A. Six. B. Four. C. Five. (5) 题目内容: Which of the following statements is correct? 选项: A. Wang Lei is from Beijing. B. Jenny is 15. C. Betty has a family of five.
ques_analyze:
【分析】不同的人分别介绍了自己及其家庭成员的情况，以及一些个人喜好。
(1) 题目解析: 细节理解题。首先，找到文中关于吉娜和她家庭地点的信息，文中明确提到'我们和父母一起住在纽约'，因此可以确定吉娜和她的家人在纽约。故选择C。
(2) 题目解析: 细节理解题。查找有关王磊家庭成员的信息，他明确表示'我没有兄弟姐妹'表明他没有姐妹，故选择B。
(3) 题目解析: 细节理解题。挑选出有关杰克打篮球伙伴的信息，文中说'杰克喜欢和同学们一起打篮球'表明杰克习惯与他的同学一起打篮球，所以应选择A。
(4) 题目解析: 细节理解题。锁定贝蒂对于梅铅笔数量的描述'梅有一个绿色的笔盒和六支铅笔'可得出梅拥有六支铅笔，因此选择A。
(5) 题目解析: 细节理解题。根据贝蒂提供的家庭情况'我有一个五口之家'可以确认她有一个五口之家，表述C正确。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: This is a photo of my family. I have a happy family. There are five people in my family. They are my grandmother, my parents, my sister, and I. The old woman is my grandmother. The man is my father. His name is David. He is a doctor. And who is the woman? She is my mother. Her name is Linda. She is very beautiful and she is a teacher. Look at the girl. That's my sister. She is a student. Her name is Lucy. The boy in the photo is me. My name is Tony. (1) 题目内容: There are __ people in this family. 选项: A. 四个 B. 五个 C. 六个 (2) 题目内容: Who is Linda? 选项: A. 托尼的姑姑 B. 托尼的姐姐 C. 托尼的妈妈 (3) 题目内容: Is David Tony's father? 选项: A. 是的 B. 不是 C. 他是 (4) 题目内容: What's the name of the boy? 选项: A. 托尼 B. 迈克 C. 大卫 (5) 题目内容: What’s Lucy’s job? 选项: A. 医生 B. 学生 C. 老师
ques_analyze:
（1）细节理解题。根据文章中的描述'我们家有五口人' 可得知，托尼家中有五个人。因此选项B是正确的。
（2）细节理解题。通过句子'她是我妈妈，名字叫琳达' 我们可以确认琳达是托尼的母亲。因此选项C是正确的。
（3）细节理解题。根据'那个男人是我爸爸，他叫大卫' 可以得知，大卫是托尼的父亲。因此选项A是正确的。
（4）细节理解题。文章中提到'照片中的男孩是我，我的名字是托尼' 可知，照片中的男孩是托尼，因此选项A是正确的。
（5）细节理解题。根据'她是个学生，名字叫露西' 我们可以得知露西的职业是学生，所以选项B是正确的。本题的考点为细节理解，需要仔细阅读材料，找到关键信息来回答问题。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Was it probable that Tang Dynasty poet Li Bai and Western hero King Arthur meet and fight against each other? Yes, in a game called King of Glory. Created by Chinese company Tencent, King of Glory was one of the most popular MOBA games in China in 2017. About one in every seven Chinese people plays the game, and 55 million of them play it every day. The game is easy for beginners. Social media like QQ and WeChat have also helped the game's community grow. New players can be invited to play the game by their WeChat contacts, with some seeing it as a good way to keep in touch with old friends and make new ones. The game has more than 60 characters to unlock and play as you progress, each with their own special style and abilities. The characters cover different times and countries. Some are real historical characters, like Li Bai. Some are not. Players use them to fight against each other or team up to fight. The winners can reach higher ranks. However, some people think King of Glory gives the students incorrect information about events and people in history. For example, the poet Li Bai is described as a killer; Jing Ke, the man who tried to kill the first emperor of China, is a girl in the game. But more people worry about children playing the game too much and spending too much money on it. Most of the players are below the age of 19. It's reported that a 17-year-old boy had a stroke after playing the game for 40 hours. To change the situation, Tencent added a time limit feature to the game to prevent kids from playing too much. From July 4, 2017, children under 12 years old can play the game for only one hour a day, while users between 12 and 18 get two hours. Those who try to play beyond the time limit will be locked out of the game. (1) 题目内容: Which of the following is TRUE about King of Glory? 选项: A. It is the most popular online game in the world. B. It offers 60 characters for players to choose from. C. All of the characters are real historical characters. D. Players fight against each other or team up to fight. (2) 题目内容: Where do you think we may read this passage? 选项: A. In a newspaper. B. In a travel guidebook. C. In a comic book. D. In a storybook. (3) 题目内容: What is Paragraph 4 mainly about? 选项: A. Children play the game too long and spend too much money. B. The game gives children incorrect information about history. C. Many people don't think the game is so good. D. The game receives a lot of praises. (4) 题目内容: The best title of the passage is: 选项: A. King of Glory—easy for anyone to play B. King of Glory—popular around the world C. King of Glory—inviting you to play D. King of Glory—adding a time limit
ques_analyze:
文章大意：本文主要介绍了腾讯公司创建的游戏《王者荣耀》的一些信息，包括游戏的受欢迎程度、对新玩家的友好性、角色选择的多样性、对历史人物和事件的描述、以及腾讯为限制儿童过度游戏而采取的措施。
(1) 细节理解题。根据第一段表述，《王者荣耀》是2017年中国极受欢迎的MOBA游戏之一，并未提到全球范围，排除A选项。游戏提供超过60个可解锁的角色，每个角色都有独特的风格和技能，因此B选项错误。游戏中的角色既包括真实的历史人物如李白，也包括其他虚构角色，所以C选项错误。最后根据第三段的描述，玩家可以使用角色互相对抗或组队作战，因此D选项正确。
(2) 推断题。整篇文章围绕《王者荣耀》的背景，游戏特点，以及腾讯的相关措施进行描述，这些内容通常出现在新闻报道中，因此最可能在报纸上阅读到此类文章，故A选项正确。
(3) 细节理解题。第四段指出有些人认为《王者荣耀》向学生提供了不准确的历史人物和事件信息，指出社会上对游戏的担忧，因此C选项正确，指出多数人对游戏持负面看法。
(4) 主旨大意题。文章最后一段讨论了腾讯为避免儿童过度游戏所加入的游戏时间限制功能，这一点对全文含义的揭示至关重要，因此D选项“王者荣耀—增加时间限制”作为文章最佳标题最为恰当。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: The Chinese boy is Li Lei. He's thirteen. He's in No.3 Middle School. He's in Class Two, Grade One. His good friend is Jack. He's English. Jack is in Li Lei's school, in Class One, Grade Two. Ms. Read is an English teacher in their school. She is an English woman and she teaches Grade 3. Jack and Li Lei have a secret. Jack is their English teacher's son. (1) 题目内容: Who's in No.3 Middle School? 选项: A. Li Lei and his friends B. Li Lei and his mother C. Li Lei, Jack and Jack's mother D. Li Lei and his father (2) 题目内容: What grade is Jack in? 选项: A. Grade Two B. Grade One C. Grade Three D. Class Two (3) 题目内容: How old is Jack? 选项: A. He is twelve. B. No, he isn't twelve. C. Sorry, I don't know. D. He's thirteen. (4) 题目内容: Is Ms. Read their English teacher? 选项: A. No, she isn't. B. Yes, she is. C. Yes, he is. D. Mr. Read is. (5) 题目内容: Which is TRUE? 选项: A. Jack isn't in No. 3 Middle School. B. Li Lei is in Class 1, Grade 1. C. Ms. Read and Jack are English. D. Ms. Read is Jack's mother.
ques_analyze: 本文介绍了李磊和他的好朋友杰克以及他们学校的一些信息。 (1) 根据文章内容，李磊和杰克都在第三中学，并且杰克的妈妈瑞德女士也在那所学校任教，因此C选项正确。 (2) 杰克的信息中提到“在二年级一班”，直接表明杰克是二年级的学生，故选择A。 (3) 文章并未提及杰克的具体年龄，所以不能确定他是否12岁，C选项表示不知道，所以正确。 (4) 瑞德女士教的是三年级的英语，而李磊和杰克分别在一年级和二年级，因此他们的英语老师不是瑞德女士，选A。 (5) 从文章中知道杰克和瑞德女士都是英格兰人，所以C选项陈述“瑞德女士和杰克都是英国人”是正确的，故选择C。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: In ancient times, children didn’t have many ways to entertain themselves. However, they came up with interesting games to enjoy their childhood.  
Kicking stone balls  
During the Qing Dynasty, kicking a stone ball was a popular game in the northern part of China, and it was often played in winter to keep warm.  
Playing hide-and-seek  
Hide-and-seek is a traditional game loved by children all over the country. There are two ways to play: covering a child’s eyes while other kids run around to tease him, or more commonly, others hide and one child must try to find them.  
Flying kites  
Kites have quite a long history. The earliest kites were made of wood, instead of paper. The most famous kites are the Beijing kite, Tianjin kite, and Weifang kite. Each kite has its own unique <u>feature</u>. For example, the bird-shaped kite with long wings is a special type of the Beijing kite.  
Watching shadow plays  
In ancient times, the closest activity to watching a film was watching a shadow play. The artists control puppets behind the screen and tell stories to the music.  

(1) 题目内容: What does the underlined word “feature” mean in the text?  
选项: A. 特征 B. 地貌 C. 五官 D. 影片  

(2) 题目内容: Which ancient game is like watching a film?  
选项: A. 踢石球 B. 放风筝 C. 捉迷藏 D. 观看皮影戏  

(3) 题目内容: According to the passage, which of the following statements is correct?  
选项: A. 踢石球是中国各地流行的游戏 B. 捉迷藏只有一种玩法 C. 最著名的风筝是北京风筝、上海风筝和潍坊风筝 D. 艺人们通过操纵木偶配合音乐讲故事。
ques_analyze:
解析：
1. 第一个问题关注词义理解。从'长翅膀的鸟形风筝是北京风筝的一种特殊类型'可以推断出，'特点'是指风筝的特征。因此，'特点'在此处指‘特征’。
2. 第二个问题是细节理解题。句子'在古代，最接近看电影的娱乐活动是观看皮影戏'指出了观看皮影戏是最接近看电影的体验，因此答案是观看皮影戏。
3. 第三个问题也是细节理解题。根据文章内容：'在清朝时期，踢石球在中国北部是一个流行的游戏'，'捉迷藏有两种玩法'，'最著名的风筝有北京风筝、天津风筝和潍坊风筝'，'艺人们在屏幕后操纵木偶并配合音乐讲述故事'，可以判断选项A有地域限制，选项B存在两种玩法，选项C提到了错误的地点，只有选项D是正确的，答案是艺人们通过操纵木偶配合音乐讲故事。
考点：本题考查学生的词义理解能力和对细节的把握能力。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容:    Nick is my good friend from England. Now let me tell you something about him. Nick is a student and he is thirteen years old. His family are in Beijing now. His father, Mr. Brown, is a manager in a hotel. His mother, Mrs. Brown, is an English teacher at his school. Nick has a sister. Her name is Kate. Now <u>they</u> study in the same school. Look! This is a picture of their school. It is very big. There is a tall building with 23 classrooms in the middle of the school. The library is behind the tall building. The sports hall is next to the library. A playground is in front of the sports hall. It's big, too. Nick and Kate like their school in Beijing very much. (1) 题目内容: Nick is in ___ now. 选项: A. 北京 B. 上海 C. 伦敦  (2) 题目内容: Nick's father is a ___. 选项: A. 教师 B. 经理 C. 演员  (3) 题目内容: 文中划线单词“他们”指的是___。 选项: A. Nick和Kate B. Kate和布朗先生 C. Nick和布朗先生  (4) 题目内容: Where is the playground? 选项: A. 在体育馆前面。 B. 在图书馆后面。 C. 在图书馆和体育馆之间。  (5) 题目内容: The best title of the passage is “___”. 选项: A. 我的图书馆 B. 我的朋友 C. 我的同学
ques_analyze:
【分析】这篇文章主要介绍了作者的英国好朋友Nick和他的家庭以及学校。通过文章的信息，可以解答以下细节理解题和词义猜测题。
(1) Nick的当前所在地点是北京，可由文章的'他的家人现在住在北京'这句得出。
(2) Nick的父亲是酒店的经理，可以通过'他的父亲，布朗先生，是一家酒店的经理'获得这一信息。
(3) '他们'在文中指的是Nick和他的妹妹Kate，这可以从'Nick有一个妹妹。她的名字是Kate。现在他们在同一所学校上学'这句话理解出来。
(4) 操场的位置在体育馆前面，由'操场在体育馆的前面'明确指出。
(5) 文章的最佳标题是'我的朋友'，因为整篇文章主要是讲述作者的英国朋友Nick，这一点由文章开头'Nick是我来自英国的好朋友'说明。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Playing video games can be a fun way to relax or spend time with friends. In some schools, teachers use games like Minecraft to encourage teamwork and communication. But for some players, gaming becomes an unhealthy habit. They stay up late playing games, do little or no homework, give up other hobbies, and pay little attention to their families and friends. The video-game world seems a friendlier place than the real one. Mental health experts have taken notice of this problem. The WHO added game disorder to its list of health conditions. A person may have the disorder if games have harmed their relationship with family and friends, or if it has influenced their daily activities. Clifford Sussman treats game addiction. He says that children who have the game disorder often get angry when a parent stops them from playing games. Then what makes video games addictive? Here is the answer. Playing video games makes players excited. After a while, the players become numb, then they lose control of themselves, so they play even more. Clifford says that players should take at least an-hour-long break after playing video games for an hour. Their brains need time to recover. Clifford advises young players to answer a simple question: “Are you in control, or is the game in control?” (1) 题目内容: 作者在第二段是通过什么方式展开他的观点的？选项: A. 使用专家意见 B. 描述个人习惯 C. 举例子 D. 介绍调查结果 (2) 题目内容: Clifford Sussman 可能是什么职业？选项: A. 教师 B. 司机 C. 工人 D. 医生 (3) 题目内容: 谁可能有游戏障碍？选项: A. Emily 对玩同样的电子游戏感到厌倦 B. Bob 几乎每天都玩游戏到凌晨4点 C. Alice 有时喜欢用智能手机听音乐 D. Simon 只在周末和同学一起玩网络游戏 (4) 题目内容: 通过回答 Sussman 的问题，我们可以知道什么？选项: A. 如何对抗游戏成瘾 B. 为什么要对抗游戏成瘾 C. 什么是游戏成瘾 D. 我们是否有游戏成瘾 (5) 题目内容: 这篇文章的最佳标题是什么？选项: A. 游戏成瘾 B. 游戏与学习 C. 困难的学校作业 D. 更聪明的游戏玩家
ques_analyze:
(1) 作者在第二段通过列举玩家的不健康习惯——如熬夜玩游戏，不做家庭作业等，来展开观点，表明游戏有可能成为不良习惯，所以正确答案为C。
(2) 根据第三段可知，Clifford Sussman 负责治疗游戏成瘾问题，这表明他从事医疗职业，因此 D 选项，即医生，是正确的。
(3) 根据第二段提到的瘾君子的特征，只有B项的Bob符合游戏成瘾者熬夜玩游戏的行为，因此B是正确答案。
(4) 文章最后一句话提出了一个关于游戏控制力的问题来帮助玩家判断是否患有游戏瘾，答案是D。
(5) 全文围绕游戏成瘾问题展开，最佳标题是体现这一主题的，A选项——游戏成瘾最符合这一点。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
问题内容: I worry about my children. They waste a lot of time in front of the computer playing games. I'd rather they read or ran around outside. How can I limit the time they spend playing games? Mrs Smith Research shows that it might be best to let children play games before doing their homework. Studies indicate that playing games before bed can affect children's sleep quality, and playing them after a learning activity can reduce the brain's ability. Alpreesh My children are only allowed to play computer games at the end of the school week and only after they have done their homework. This rule is very clear to them, and they have accepted it happily. As a result, we have fewer arguments during the week. It's really been good for us. Cage I personally find it difficult to set time limits, but when the kids are on the computer, I get some quiet time. I built and now use a simple timer program that lets me set time limits (like 1 hour each day). The program gives the kids an audible reminder like "5 minutes left", and they have to stop when their time is up. It has ended all the fighting over computer time in our house. You can download it from http://www.TimesUpKids.com. John

(1) Mrs Smith的问题是__. 选项: A. 她的孩子们不喜欢学习 B. 她的孩子们不懂得如何利用时间 C. 她的孩子们花太多时间在电脑游戏上

(2) Alpreesh的观点是__. 选项: A. 限制孩子们玩游戏的时间是没有用的 B. 孩子们可以在睡觉前玩游戏 C. 在做作业前玩游戏是个好主意

(3) __使用了计时程序来限制孩子们玩电脑的时间。 选项: A. Mrs Smith B. Alpreesh C. John

(4) 下划线单词 “audible” 在中文中的意思是 “__”。 选项: A. 可触及的 B. 可听到的 C. 频繁的

(5) 你觉得这篇文章可能出现在哪里__. 选项: A. 在互联网上 B. 在报纸上 C. 在故事书中
ques_analyze: 本文讨论了四位家长如何处理孩子玩电脑游戏的问题。对于Mrs Smith的问题，第一段提到她的孩子在电脑前浪费太多时间，所以(1)的答案是C。Alpreesh在第二段建议学习活动之后玩游戏，并提到研究显示睡觉前玩游戏对睡眠有害，因此(2)的答案是C。John在第四段介绍了他使用的计时程序来限制孩子的电脑时间，所以(3)的答案是C。下划线词'audible'意思是'听得到的'，所以(4)的答案是B。最后，由于文本中提到可以从一个网址下载程序，因此(5)的答案是A。阅读理解的技巧是全面阅读后，带着问题寻找答案，直接而不复杂。例如，第1小题直接从第一段信息可以得出答案C。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: This boy is Peter Brown. He is from the USA. He is in No.3 Middle School. He is in Class 5, Grade 7. His school ID card number is 279-4856. His English teacher is Miss White. Miss White is a good teacher. Jack is his good friend at school. They are in the same school and the same grade. Mrs. Green is Jack's mom. She is an English teacher, too. She is in this school, too. But Peter does not know it. (1) 题目内容: Peter's school ID card number is __. 选项: A. 279-4856 B. 297-4856 C. 279-4956 D. 279-4866 (2) 题目内容: Peter's English teacher is __. 选项: A. Jack B. Brown C. Mrs. Green D. Miss White (3) 题目内容: Mrs. Green and Jack are __. 选项: A. mother and son B. father and daughter C. mother and daughter D. father and son (4) 题目内容: Which of the following statements is correct? 选项: A. Jack isn't in Grade 7. B. Peter and Jack are good friends. C. Mrs. Green is a Chinese teacher. D. Peter is Mrs. Green's son.
ques_analyze: 本文介绍了七年级五班的学生彼得和他的好朋友杰克，以及他们的一些个人信息和学校生活。 (1) 细节理解题。从文章第一段中可以找到彼得的学生证号码：“His school ID card number is 279-4856.”因此正确答案是279-4856，选A。 (2) 细节理解题。文章中提到：“His English teacher is Miss White.”明确告诉我们彼得的英语老师是怀特小姐，因此选D。 (3) 细节理解题。根据文章中“Mrs. Green is Jack's mom.”可知，格林女士是杰克的母亲。既然杰克是男生，格林女士和杰克的关系就是母子，选A。 (4) 细节理解题。根据文章“Jack is his good friend at school.”我们知道杰克和彼得是好朋友，并且都在七年级，与B选项描述相符，因此选择B。总结：阅读理解题主要考查学生根据文章内容选取正确答案的能力，通过细节判断来找到正确选项。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: Lots of kids love video games. In fact, they might hear something like this from mom or dad: “Enough! Stop and find something else to do!” It can be good advice. Studies show that video games can be good for hand-eye coordination, problem-solving skills, and the mind’s ability. But too much video game playing can cause health problems. It’s hard to get enough active play and exercise if you’re always inside playing video games. And without enough exercise, kids can become overweight. Playing too many video games also can be bad for kids’ friendships and school grades. But here’s the good news, playing games some of the time can be OK. Just for no more than 1 or 2 hours a week and choose good games. What’s a good game? That depends on how old you are. Your mom or dad can help choose some that are good for you. If you can choose one to make yourself better and make progress, that’s even better. As a teenager, you might challenge your mom, dad — or even your grandma — to play with them or try some cartoons. By doing so, you can improve friendship with them and even make them feel good. But most teenagers dislike doing so. They prefer to play alone or with friends. But to be honest, this really makes a great difference. There’s a lot of discussion these days about video games. Parents and teachers want to know how to help kids choose good games. 

(1) 题目内容: Studies show that for kids video games are __. 选项: A. harmful B. helpful C. tiring D. necessary 

(2) 题目内容: It’s __ for school children to play too many video games. 选项: A. good B. friendly C. bad D. lonely 

(3) 题目内容: Children can choose good games with the help of __. 选项: A. their teachers B. their friends C. their parents D. the computer 

(4) 题目内容: The problem about playing video games is __. 选项: A. how to deal with school work B. how to plan their play time well C. how to deal with their friendships D. how to help choose good games
ques_analyze: 首先，考虑到文章内容表明电子游戏可以促进手眼协调能力、解决问题的能力和认知能力，答案B（有益的）与这一点吻合（第一题分析）。接着，文章提到过多玩电子游戏可能损害孩子的友谊和学习成绩，说明这是一个不利的后果，答案C（不好的）是正确的（第二题分析）。然后，文章指出家长可以帮助孩子选择适合他们的游戏，因此选项C（他们的父母）是正确答案（第三题分析）。最后，文章的讨论重点在于家长和老师希望知道如何帮助孩子选择好的游戏，因此对于第四题，选择答案D（如何帮助选择好的游戏）是合适的。整篇文章旨在解释电子游戏对儿童的影响以及如何正确选择游戏，这是文章的核心主题。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: You are watching a film in which two men are having a fight. They hit one another hard. At the start they only fight with their fists. But soon they begin hitting one another over the heads with chairs. And so it goes on until one of the men crashes through a window and falls thirty feet to the ground below. He is dead! Of course he isn’t really dead. With any luck he isn’t even hurt. Why? Because the men who fall out of high windows or jump from fast moving trains, who crash cars or even catch fire, are professionals. They do this for a living. These men are called stuntmen. That is to say, they perform tricks. There are two sides to their work. They actually do most of the things you see on the screen. For example, they fall from a high building. However, they do not fall on to hard ground but on to empty cardboard boxes covered with a mattress. Again, when they hit one another with chairs, the chairs are made of soft wood and when they crash through windows, the glass is made of sugar! Although their work depends on tricks of this kind, it also requires a high degree of skill and training. Often a stuntman’s success depends on careful timing. For example, when he is “blown up” in a battle scene, he has to jump out of the way of the explosion just at the right moment. Naturally stuntmen are well paid for their work, but they lead dangerous lives. They often get badly injured, and sometimes killed. A Norwegian stuntman, for example, skied over the edge of a cliff a thousand feet high. His parachute failed to open, and he was killed. In spite of all the risks, this is no longer a profession for men only. Men no longer dress up as women when actresses have to perform some dangerous action. For nowadays there are stuntwomen, too! (1) 题目内容: The author wrote Para.1 and Para.2 to lead in a __. 选项: A. film B. fight C. job D. trick (2) 题目内容: Stuntmen are those who __. 选项: A. play their funny tricks B. perform their special skills C. prefer to lead dangerous lives D. often fight each other for their lives (3) 题目内容: When a stuntman falls from a high building, __. 选项: A. he needs little protection B. he will be covered with a mattress C. he must be excited D. his safety is generally all right (4) 题目内容: We can infer that __ from the example in the last paragraph. 选项: A. an accident may happen to a stuntman B. the stuntman must be too heavy C. parachutes must be of good quality D. the cliff might be so dangerous
ques_analyze: 首先，我们可以看到段落1和2通过一系列的场景描述引出特技演员的工作，旨在显现特技演员工作的真实性和专业性。准确地推理出这些描述都是为了引出‘职业’这一主题，因此(1)选C。其次，特技演员所进行的危险动作不是真实的战斗，而是精心设计且经过训练的特技，根本于他们的特殊技能，故(2)选B。接着，尽管他们执行危险动作，例如从高楼掉下，但他们有相应的安全措施，例如地面上的软垫子，因此可以推断他们的安全通常得到保障，故(3)选D。最后，通过悬崖跳伞的例子，我们可以得知，尽管大部分时候特技演员的表演是安全的，但仍然存在意外发生的风险，因此(4)选A。这高亮显示了特技演员工作的高风险和技能水平。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: My name is Kate. I’m twelve years old and I’m a middle school student. I live in a happy family. My mom and dad are workers, they go to work from Monday to Friday. I have a lovely brother, he’s Bill and he’s nine years old. He likes playing with me and we often enjoy Peppa Pig together. On weekends, our family goes to the park near our home and do some exercise. I like my school, it's very beautiful. There are forty students in my class, and twenty-five are boys. We have our classes from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. I have a good friend in my class. Her name is Lily. We often go home together after school. Our Chinese teacher, Miss Su, is from China. She is kind and we like her very much. We have three Chinese classes a week, now we think Chinese is very interesting. (1) 题目内容: Kate’s parents are __.选项: A. teachers B. workers C. doctors D. actors (2) 题目内容: Kate’s brother is __ years old.选项: A. eight B. eleven C. nine D. twelve (3) 题目内容: Kate’s good friend is __.选项: A. Lucy B. Lily C. Daisy D. Nancy (4) 题目内容: Miss Su comes from __.选项: A. China B. America C. England D. Japan (5) 题目内容: Kate has __ Chinese classes a week.选项: A. three B. four C. five D. six
ques_analyze:
本文介绍了作者的个人信息、家庭信息及学校信息。
(1) 根据句子'我的爸爸妈妈是工人'，我们可以明确得知凯特的父母是工人，因此答案选择B。
(2) 通过句子'我有一个可爱的弟弟，他叫比尔，今年九岁'，坚定地指出凯特的弟弟是9岁，选项C正确。
(3) 查找到句子'我班上有一个好朋友，她叫莉莉'，这样我们可以确认凯特的好朋友是莉莉，所以答案为B。
(4) 文中句子'我们的中文老师苏老师来自中国'告诉我们苏老师来自中国，答案选A。
(5) 最后，句子'我们每周有三节中文课'清晰地说明了每周有三节中文课，因此选择A。
这些问题检验了学生的细节理解能力，并重在考察学生从文章中寻找和分析具体细节的能力。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容:    Good afternoon, boys and girls. I’m Liu Shusheng. I’m an English boy. Liu Shusheng is my Chinese name. Look, this is a picture of my family. The tall man is my father. His name is Ken Martin. This is my mother, Sandy Jordan. Who’s that little girl? She’s my sister, Mary. Can you find me in the picture? I’m the boy in green. (1) 题目内容: This is a __ family. 选项: A. Chinese B. English C. American (2) 题目内容: There are __ people in the picture. 选项: A. one B. two C. four (3) 题目内容: __ is my father. 选项: A. Sandy B. Ken C. Ms Martin (4) 题目内容: __ is my mother. 选项: A. Sandy B. Ken C. Martin (5) 题目内容: What color am I in? I am in __. 选项: A. brown B. black C. green
ques_analyze: 本文是一篇说明文，主要介绍了英国男孩刘书生的家庭信息。对于题1，文中'我是一个英国男孩'清晰表明刘书生是英国男孩，因此这是一个英国家庭，选项B正确。对于题2，文中展示了全家照片，并点名了爸爸肯·马丁，妈妈桑迪·乔丹，妹妹玛丽和刘书生自己共四个人，因此照片中共有四人，选项C正确。对于题3，文中明确提到高个子的男人是我的父亲，他的名字是肯·马丁，因此选项B正确。在考察题4时，文中直接提供信息'这位是我的母亲，桑迪·乔丹'明确指出桑迪是刘书生的母亲，故选项A正确。最后，对于题5，文中说'我穿着绿色的衣服'表达了刘书生穿着绿色衣服的事实，所以选项C正确。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: Name Grade Favorite Color Favorite Sport Favorite Food Helen Hill Eight Green Table Tennis Bread & Carrots Eric Miller Seven Black Baseball Hamburgers & Ice Cream Mary Brown Two Pink Football Tomatoes & Eggs Henry Green Seven Blue Tennis Chicken & Salad

(1) 题目内容: What is Helen's surname? 选项: A. Brown. B. Hill. C. Miller. D. Green.

(2) 题目内容: Which of the following would be a suitable birthday gift for Mary? 选项: A. A baseball bat. B. A soccer ball. C. A ping-pong paddle. D. A tennis racket.

(3) 题目内容: Which two students are in the same class? 选项: A. Eric and Helen. B. Mary and Eric. C. Eric and Henry. D. Helen and Mary.

(4) 题目内容: According to the table, which of these statements is true? 选项: A. Henry's favorite sport is baseball. B. Mary's favorite color is blue. C. Helen's preferred food includes tomatoes. D. Eric's diet is not considered healthy.

(5) 题目内容: The passage mainly describes their __. 选项: A. favorite activities B. food preferences C. favorite hobbies D. school subjects
ques_analyze:
(1) 解析：确认Helen Hill的姓氏是Hill。所以答案为B。 
(2) 解析：从表格中看到，Mary Brown最喜欢足球，所以她的生日礼物应该与足球相关。故答案B正确。 
(3) 解析：根据表格，Eric Miller和Henry Green都在七年级，所以他们在同一个班级。故答案为C。 
(4) 解析：Henry最喜欢的运动是网球，而不是棒球，故A错误。Mary最喜欢的颜色是粉色，而不是蓝色，故B错误。Helen喜欢吃面包和胡萝卜，没有提到西红柿，故C错误。Eric喜欢吃汉堡和冰激凌，这些通常不被认为是健康食物，因此D正确。
(5) 解析：这篇文章主要描述了学生们最喜欢的颜色、运动和食物，这些是他们偏爱的活动。故答案为A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Imagine if your journey to work was just from your bedroom to your living room. More and more people in the UK are working from home. Baz is an engineer at a factory in West London. He has been an engineer since he left school, but he is not very optimistic about his future. Heavy industry in the UK has almost disappeared, and more people work in Indian restaurants than in steel, coal, and shipbuilding combined! Baz often gets tired of his long commute. Whether he drives or takes public transport, his daily commute can take up to two hours. His sister, Liz, lives in the north of England and is an Information Technology (IT) trainer at a college. She meets her trainees in person once every four weeks, but most of her training is done through IT. Baz's wife, Helen, seldom travels to work at all. She is a graphic designer for a London advertising company. Once the children are off to school, she starts working in front of her computer. She is currently designing publicity material for a major London festival. When she finishes her designs, she sends them electronically to her director, who also works from home. Occasionally, they meet up for a coffee. Most people in the UK, like Baz, spend hours commuting and complain about it, but an increasing number of people are becoming telecommuters, like Helen or Liz. Almost all of their work is done online or by phone. There are about a million telecommuters in the UK, roughly 10 percent of the workforce. (1) 题目内容: Heavy industry has almost disappeared, so __. 选项: A. more people work in steel B. more people work in restaurants C. more people work in coal D. more people work in shipbuilding (2) 题目内容: According to the text, Liz mainly does some training __. 选项: A. at a college B. in person C. through IT D. by phone (3) 题目内容: __ would say, “With three kids, working from home means I have to keep the balance of my work and personal lives.” 选项: A. Baz B. Liz C. Helen D. The writer (4) 题目内容: The underlined word “telecommuters” means __. 选项: A. people who work at home with the help of a phone and the network B. people who send messages over long distances by telephone, radio, television, etc. C. people who speak to each other using telephone and video connections D. people who take photos for people from different places to make a living (5) 题目内容: Which of the following will most probably be discussed in the next paragraph? 选项: A. What are the advantages of working at home? B. What can people gain from traveling to work? C. What are people busy making a living for? D. Why do telecommuters need their own organization? (6) 题目内容: What would be the best title for the text? 选项: A. Baz, Liz and Helen B. A new way of working C. Jobs in the future D. Technology creates new jobs
ques_analyze:
本文是一篇说明文，主要介绍了几个人不同的工作模式以及在家办公的趋势。
(1) 细节理解题。从文章描述“印度餐馆的员工比钢铁、煤炭和造船行业加起来还要多！”中可以看出，相较于重工业，现在更多的人选择在餐馆工作。因此，正确答案是B。
(2) 细节理解题。从文本中“但大部分培训都是通过信息技术进行的”可知，莉兹主要通过信息技术进行培训。因此，正确答案是C。
(3) 推理判断题。根据文本中“孩子们上学后，她便开始在电脑前工作……”可以推测，在家的海伦需要平衡工作和照顾孩子的责任。因此，正确答案是C。
(4) 词义猜测题。结合文本中“像海伦或莉兹一样成为远程工作者。他们几乎所有的工作都是通过网络或电话完成的”可以推测，“远程工作者”指的是用电话和网络在家工作的人。因此，正确答案是A。
(5) 推理判断题。考虑到文章线索提到在家工作人数的增加，下一段可能会讨论其优点。因此，正确答案是A。
(6) 最佳标题题。整篇文章讨论的是在家工作这种新的工作方式，因此，最合适的标题是关于这种方式的。因此，正确答案是B。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Whether you play e-sports or not, you might have heard of iG, a Chinese e-sports club. On the night of November 3, 2018, iG beat a European e-sports club and won the 2018 League of Legends (LOL) World Cup in Korea. It was the first time in the event's eight-year history that a Chinese club won. The victory showed how e-sports has progressed in China in recent years. A growing number of e-sports clubs have been set up in China in the last 10 years or so, and more young gamers are working as professional players. However, becoming a professional e-sports player is not all about having fun or playing games. A professional player should have certain abilities, including enough patience and very quick reactions. Professional players can have 400 actions within one minute. However, players can't maintain this level all the time. The prime age for professional players is from 17 to 25, and after 25, they become slower. E-sports players have to work hard every day. "We start to practice right after we get up in the morning and usually last until midnight," said Huang Fuquan, a player from iG. "There is at least 12 hours of work every day." Many players practice so much that their bodies may easily get hurt, and they also face a lot of pressure. Some e-sports clubs have doctors and psychologists to help their players. The road to being a professional player is not smooth. So if you want to turn your love for gaming into a full-time job, ask yourself this first: Are you really prepared? Because you need to make a lot more effort than others. (1) 题目内容: When was the first LOL World Cup held? 选项: A. 2010 B. 2011 C. 2018 (2) 题目内容: Which of the following is NOT mentioned as an ability that the player should have? 选项: A. High patience B. Quick reactions C. Smart brains (3) 题目内容: According to the passage, which is NOT TRUE below? 选项: A. There are more and more e-sports clubs in China B. To be a professional e-sport player needs to be really prepared C. The best age of a professional player is after 25 (4) 题目内容: What's the meaning of the underlined word "psychologist"? 选项: A. 教练 B. 心理医生 C. 营养师 (5) 题目内容: What's the main idea of the whole passage? 选项: A. A Chinese e-sports club iG won the 2018 LOL World Cup in Korea B. To be e-sports players is not easy and they pay a lot more than others C. More young gamers should work as professional e-sports players
ques_analyze: 【分析】本文讲述了中国电子竞技俱乐部iG赢得历史上第一个LOL世界杯的事迹，并强调成为职业电子竞技选手的难度和所需能力。(1) 根据文中信息，iG队在2018年获胜，该事件发生在赛事的第八个年头，因此第一届应该是2011年。(2) 文章提到选手需要具备耐心和快速反应的能力，没有提及需要聪明头脑，因此C选项正确。(3) 文中提到选手的黄金年龄是17到25岁，超过25岁反应会慢，因此C选项“25岁以后是职业选手的最佳年龄”是不正确的。(4) 文章提到选手面临很大压力，因此俱乐部配备医生和心理医生帮助选手，下划线单词“psychologist”指的是心理医生，即B选项。(5) 全文通过描述职业电子竞技选手的经历和需求，阐明了成为职业选手的困难和付出，因此B选项“成为职业选手不容易，他们付出比其他人更多的努力”最合适。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: Welcome to our website! Welcome to the BISS world! Here is something about us. Our classroom sizes are quite small. Every class has 15 students, so teachers can care for each student. Not only our class, but also the school size is small. It’s good for students and teachers to be in a small school. For example, the teachers know every student and his or her parents in our school. Even the Head of the school is able to get to know every student and their parents. In a small school, each child can try what they like. If they like to play basketball, they can join the team and take part in the games. In addition, BISS is one of the caring schools. We focus on the needs of children and families. Come and visit us. You will sense the BISS feeling as soon as you walk in the door. We are part of it and proud of it. 

(1) 题目内容: You can read this passage on__ 选项: A. a textbook B. a newspaper C. TV D. the Internet 

(2) 题目内容: Every class in BISS School has__ students. 选项: A. 15 B. 30 C. 35 D. 45 

(3) 题目内容: The underlined word “focus on” means__ in Chinese. 选项: A. 采纳 B. 找到 C. 关注 D. 背景 

(4) 题目内容: The teachers and the Head of the school both__ 选项: A. can get on well with every student B. can help to teach each student at school C. can know the home of every student D. can know every student and their parents 

(5) 题目内容: Which of the following is NOT true according to the passage? 选项: A. The classroom and the school size are small. B. Students cannot play basketball in the school. C. Everyone can try what he or she likes in the school. D. BISS is one of the caring schools.
ques_analyze:
这篇文章介绍了BISS学校的一些特点。通过阅读文章，我们可以获得以下信息：
(1) 文章出现在互联网上。根据文章开头的'欢迎来到我们的网站'，可以确定文章是来自网络。
(2) 每个班级有15名学生。这是从文章第二段'每个班级有15名学生'中获取的直接信息。
(3) '关注'的意思是关注。这是从文章中对BISS学校的描述得出的结论，BISS学校关注孩子和家庭的需求，所以'关注'在这里的意思是关注。
(4) 学校的老师和校长都认识每个学生及其家长。文章中提到教师和校长都了解每个学生及其父母的情况，说明他们之间有密切的联系。
(5) 学生可以在学校打篮球。文章提到'如果他们喜欢打篮球，他们可以加入球队并参加比赛'，说明学生有机会参与篮球活动。因此，选项B的陈述是不正确的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: For us boys and girls, books are not all. We can find time to play at home or at school. Playing is about having fun, but how do we play? It doesn't mean watching TV or playing computer games. In the morning, we can run with our parents to stay healthy. After school, we can play sports with friends. We can also do what we like after class. For example, we can draw, and we can play chess with others. It is also fun to help others. Playing can make children happy and they won't feel bored. It can also help students get on well with others and it is good for them. Play well and then you can learn well. (1) 题目内容: According to the passage, what can children do in the morning? 选项: A. Watch TV B. Play computer games C. Run with parents D. Learn Maths (2) 题目内容: When children are playing, they are __. 选项: A. sad B. happy C. hungry D. bored (3) 题目内容: Which one is TRUE according to the passage? 选项: A. Playing means watching TV B. Playing means playing computer games C. Children can't play at school D. Playing is good for children (4) 题目内容: The underlined word "It" means "__". 选项: A. Playing B. Reading C. Studying D. Helping
ques_analyze: 本文讨论了玩耍对孩子的好处及其方式，明确指出玩耍并非看电视或玩电脑游戏。文中提到早上孩子们可以和父母跑步，因此第(1)题答案为C。对于玩耍带来的情感状态，文中说明玩耍能使孩子感到快乐，不会感到无聊，因而第(2)题答案为B。玩耍对孩子们有诸多益处，能帮助他们和别人相处融洽，因此第(3)题正确答案为D。最后，划线词‘它’指的是前文提到的‘玩耍’，故第(4)题答案为A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: A game of catch is simply two people throwing a ball back and forth. It seems a little boring. The two people are close enough to talk, but too far to touch. They might have baseball gloves, or they might use their hands. In fact, playing catch is part of baseball practice – to make you get used to using a ball and glove. But any American kid will tell you it’s much more than that. Playing catch is a time to be with your father. It’s a time when there’s nothing to worry about besides catching a ball. It’s a time when words move as seamlessly as the ball itself, back and forth, easy and relaxing. It’s an excuse to spend time together. Because baseball is an American sport, and a big part of being American, playing catch is kind of an all-American dad activity. In the suburbs, most people have backyards – not large enough to play baseball in, but just big enough for a game of catch. Those without yards play in the street. When adults are asked to talk about the good memories of their dads, many of them will say something about playing catch. Why? Probably because dads are usually very busy. A catch game is a time that is only for one thing. This is a time when a kid has his or her dad’s attention. There is no work, no phone and no other people around to take your dad away from you. <u>For the time that it takes to play a game of catch, your dad is all yours.</u> (1) 题目内容: What means the most in playing catch? 选项: A. To throw the ball back and forth. B. To catch the ball. C. To relax with your father. D. To practice baseball. (2) 题目内容: Which of the following is TRUE about playing catch according to Paragraph 4? 选项: A. Playing catch is an American activity. B. Kids usually play catch with friends. C. People need a big backyard to play catch. D. People can hardly play catch without baseball gloves. (3) 题目内容: Which description mostly fits the underlined statement “<u>For the time that it takes to play a game of catch, your dad is all yours.</u>”? 选项: A. Mothers are always too busy to play with you. B. It’s just a time when you can have all your father’s attention. C. All kids like playing with their dads instead of mothers. D. Your father likes playing catch so that other people around won’t take him away from you. (4) 题目内容: What is the best title for the article? 选项: A. American Baseball. B. How to play catch. C. Happy memories at home. D. More than just a game.
ques_analyze:
【分析】这篇短文讲述了接球游戏（playing catch）在美国孩子们心中的特殊意义，特别是与父亲共度时光的珍贵和回忆。
(1) 根据文章第二段的内容“但是任何一个美国孩子都会告诉你，玩接球不仅仅是这些。玩接球是和你爸爸在一起的时光。” 可理解，对于美国孩子来说，接球游戏不仅仅是扔回接球那么简单，而是与父亲共度轻松时光的机会，所以答案选C。
(2) 第四段提到“玩接球也成了一种美式父亲活动。” 说明接球游戏是美国父亲们常做的活动，符合A选项的说法，故答案选A。
(3) 划线句子“在玩接球的时间里，你的爸爸完全属于你。” 和文章内容“这是一个孩子能得到他或她的爸爸注意力的时刻。” 都表明，在玩接球游戏的期间，孩子能完全得到父亲的关注与陪伴，因此B选项“这是你能得到爸爸全部注意力的时间。” 与之相符，答案选择B。
(4) 从全文来看，文章通过介绍接球游戏，强调了它超越了游戏本身，是孩子与父亲亲密相处的桥梁，留下了美好的回忆，因此D选项“不只是一个游戏。” 最能贴切地反映文章的中心思想，答案选D。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Xiang Xiang is a panda. He was born in Japan last year. He is very cute and busy. He has to work over four hours to meet Japanese fans these months. Xiang Xiang worked from 9:45 a.m. to 12:15 p.m. at Ueno Zoo last year. But the zoo had to extend the viewing hours to 4:45 p.m. from February, because many people wanted to visit Xiang Xiang. After that, over 10,000 visitors saw Xiang Xiang at the zoo each day. Now the zoo is thinking about building a new house for Xiang Xiang. Many young people play a mobile game called Travel Frog on WeChat. In the game, players can buy a backpack and other things for a frog and then send it off for trips. When the frog comes back from the travel, it can send postcards and bring back some special food for the players. After finishing the trip, the frog only does some easy activities, such as drinking soup, reading books, or writing a diary. The Japanese company Hit-point made the game last autumn. Dogs are much better at smelling things than people. The policemen always need help from police dogs. Training a police dog usually takes 12 weeks. The policemen teach the dog to remember the smell of a thing. They hide the thing in a place and tell the dog to bring it back. When it does so, they give the dog a bone as a reward. (1) 题目内容: The underlined phrase "extend the viewing hours" means “__”. 选项: A. 扩大动物园面积 B. 使更多人快乐 C. 延长参观时间 D. 让更多人进入场所 (2) 题目内容: When you play the game Travel Frog, you can __. 选项: A. 赚很多钱 B. 从日本获得一只宠物青蛙 C. 送你的青蛙去旅行 D. 和你的青蛙一起游遍日本 (3) 题目内容: Which of the following is NOT true? 选项: A. 训练一只狗通常需要三个月。 B. 日本公司Hit-point开发了微信。 C. 狗可以通过气味记住东西。 D. 香香可能会有一个新家。
ques_analyze: 【分析】文章介绍了熊猫香香、游戏《旅行青蛙》和警犬的训练。第一个问题是理解文中的短语“extend the viewing hours”。从文中香香工作时间从上午9:45到中午12:15变为下午4:45，说明动物园延长了参观时间，并不是扩大动物园面积、使更多人快乐或者让更多人进入，故选C——延长参观时间。第二个问题是关于《旅行青蛙》游戏，文中提及玩家可以为青蛙购买背包等东西然后派它去旅行，这说明玩家可以让自己的青蛙进行旅行，因此选C——送你的青蛙去旅行。最后一个问题是寻找非真实描述的选项，A项由"训练一只狗通常需要12周"得知通常训练狗需要12周，相当于3个月，所以A项是真实的；C项由"警察教狗记住某个东西的气味"可知警犬可以通过气味记住事物，说明C项是真实的；D项由"现在动物园正在考虑为香香建一个新家"可知动物园正在考虑为香香建新房，表明D项是真实的。B项的错误在于文章并未提及任何信息指出日本公司Hit-point开发了微信，因此B是不真实的描述。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容:    Li Ming is a five-year-old boy. He is very happy because he has a little sister now. He often says to his mother, "Mom, I like my little sister. I can play games with her. I'll give my food to her." His parents are very happy to hear this. They don't need to worry that their son won't like his little sister. Their son likes his sister very much. Now every family can have two children, but many children don't want their parents to have another baby. They don't want to share their food, toys, clothes, and other things with their brothers or sisters. So many parents want to have another baby, but they are afraid their sons or daughters won't agree. (1) 题目内容: Li Ming is a __. 选项: A. girl B. boy C. adult  (2) 题目内容: Why is Li Ming very happy? 选项: A. Because he has a new toy. B. Because his parents take him to a park. C. Because he has a little sister now.  (3) 题目内容: What will Li Ming give to his little sister? 选项: A. food B. toys C. clothes  (4) 题目内容: The underlined word "worry" means __ in Chinese. 选项: A. 担忧 B. 快乐 C. 拥有  (5) 题目内容: From the passage, we know __. 选项: A. Li Ming's parents are teachers. B. Li Ming doesn't like his little sister. C. Li Ming is a good boy, because he likes his little sister very much.
ques_analyze:
【分析】本文是一篇记叙文，主要描述了李明非常高兴因为他现在有了一个小妹妹。作者通过李明的行为和态度表明现在很多孩子担心家庭增加新的成员，但李明与众不同，他对此表示欢迎。
(1) 细节理解题。根据文章第一句‘李明是一个五岁的男孩’明确指出李明是男孩，故选B。
(2) 细节理解题。文章中指出李明很高兴的原因是‘因为他现在有了一个小妹妹’，即现在他有了一个小妹妹，故选C。
(3) 细节理解题。李明表达愿意和妹妹分享的具体事物是‘我会把我的食物给她’，表明他要给妹妹食物，故选A。
(4) 词义猜测题。文中指出李明的家庭避免了担心的情况，因为他喜欢他的小妹妹，与其他可能不希望父母生第二个孩子的家庭形成对比，由此推断‘担心’的意思是担忧，故选A。
(5) 细节理解题。通过李明对待妹妹的方式，我们可以推知李明是一个好孩子，因为他非常喜欢他的小妹妹，并愿意与她分享，表现出了积极的家庭关系，故选C。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Mrs. White asks Monica, "Do you like to have a treasure hunt?" "Yes, Mom," Monica answers. Mrs. White gives her a green note. It says, "You can find books in it." Monica comes to the bookcase and sees a yellow note. It says, "You can sit on <u>it</u>." Monica comes to the bed but can't find a note. She comes to the chair and sees a red note. It says, "You can put your tape in it." Monica comes to the tape player and sees an orange note next to it. It says, "Call 786-0987." Monica comes to the phone on the table and calls 786-0987. "Hello? This is Aunt Maria." "Oh, Aunt Maria, my treasure is you!" says Monica. (1) 题目内容: What color is the note in the bookcase? 选项: A. Green. B. Yellow. C. Red. D. Orange. (2) 题目内容: What does the underlined word "it" refer to? 选项: A. The bookcase. B. The bed. C. The chair. D. The tape player. (3) 题目内容: How many notes does Monica find after Mrs. White gives her the green note? 选项: A. Two. B. Three. C. Four. D. Five.
ques_analyze: 【分析】本文讲述了Monica和她的妈妈Mrs. White进行寻宝游戏的故事。通过阅读，我们依次找到关键信息，解决问题。(1) 根据文中提示，Monica在书架上找到了黄色的便条，因此答案为B。(2) 要找出画线的'它'指代的内容，我们看到Monica找到一张写着'你可以坐在它上面'的红色便条后，走向椅子，这表明'它'指的是椅子，因此答案为C。(3) Monica在得到绿色便条后，又接连找到三张便条：书架上的黄色便条，椅子上的红色便条和录音机旁的橙色便条。因此答案为B。结合题目，这个寻宝游戏旨在铭记家人和亲情的重要性，这是题目的点睛之笔。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Dear Jerry, How are you? I’m in New York, at the International School of English. I’m in Class 4 with seven students. They are from different countries and are very friendly. We often do sports after classes, but I can’t play any ball games. They are too <u>hard</u> for me. Paul is our teacher. He is a good teacher. I live with a local family. Mr and Mrs Hill have three children. Kate is sixteen, Dam is thirteen, and Hunter is eight. They all like me, but I can’t understand their English. New York is a very big city. It’s cool now and the parks are beautiful. I like the food very much. Please write to me. Yours, Lucy (1) 题目内容: The students study __ at this school. 选项: A. French B. English C. Chinese D. Japanese (2) 题目内容: How many students are there in Lucy’s class? 选项: A. Seven B. Eight C. Nine D. Ten (3) 题目内容: In Mr Hill’s family, __ is the oldest child. 选项: A. Dam B. Hunter C. Kate D. Paul (4) 题目内容: The underline word <u>hard</u> means “__” 选项: A. wonderful B. diligent C. difficult D. boring
ques_analyze: 这是一封Lucy写给Jerry的信，信中介绍了她所在的学校及老师的情况，并介绍了她所在的寄宿家庭。问题(1)是细节理解题。根据文中'我现在在纽约，国际英语学校学习'可知，Lucy就读于一所英文学校，所以学习的是英语。问题(2)也是细节理解题。文中提到'我在四班，有七个同学'说明Lucy的班级有她在内的八个学生。问题(3)中，根据'Kate十六岁，Dam十三岁，Hunter八岁'可以知道Kate是三个孩子中最年长的。问题(4)是词句猜测题。通过'我们经常在课后做运动。但我不会玩任何球类游戏'表明对Lucy来说，球类游戏很困难，即'难'在此处意为'困难的'。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Why play games? Because they are fun, and a lot more besides. Following the rules, planning your next move, acting as a team member—these are all "game" ideas that you will have throughout your life. Think about some of the games you played as a young child, such as rope-jumping and hide-and-seek. Some games are entertaining and fun. But perhaps more importantly, <u>they translate life into exciting dreams</u> that teach children some of the basic rules they will be expected to follow the rest of their lives, such as taking turns and teamwork. Many children's games have a practical side. Children around the world play games that prepare them for work they will do as adults. For example, some Saudi Arabian children play a game called Bones. It can be very helpful to exercise their hands and eyes, which is needed in hunting. Many sports encourage national or local pride. The most famous games of all, the Olympic Games, bring athletes from around the world together to take part in the friendly competition. People who watch the event wave flags, knowing that a gold medal is a win for an entire country, not just the athlete who has got it. For countries experiencing natural disasters or war, an Olympic win can mean so much. Sports can bring people together. Soccer is the most popular sport in the world. People on all continents play it—some for fun and some for a living. Nicolette Iribame, a Californian soccer player, has discovered a way to spread hope through soccer. He set up an organization which can provide poor children with not only soccer balls but also a hopeful future. Next time, when you play your favorite game or sport, think about why you enjoy it, what skills are needed, and whether these skills will help you in your life. (1) 题目内容: According to paragraph 1, which of the following is not the idea of games? 选项: A. Following the rules. B. Planning the next move. C. Acting as a team member. D. Making more friends. (2) 题目内容: The underlined part "translate life into exciting dreams" in paragraph 2 most probably means that games can __. 选项: A. Describe life in an exciting way. B. Turn real-life experiences into a play. C. Change people's views of sporting. D. Teach children something useful and important. (3) 题目内容: According to the passage, why is winning Olympic medals so encouraging? 选项: A. It means a lot for a whole country. B. It proves how excellent the winners are. C. It helps the country out of natural disasters. D. It brings the winners satisfaction and money. (4) 题目内容: Which of the following statements is NOT true? 选项: A. The most famous games are the Olympic Games. B. People around the world play soccer just for fun. C. The game called Bones can be helpful to the Arabian children. D. Nicolette Iribame gives poor children a chance for a better life. (5) 题目内容: What is the passage mainly about? 选项: A. The popular games. B. Games and real life. C. The advantages of games. D. Children's games and the future.
ques_analyze: (1) 细节理解题。通过阅读第一段，可以找到相关信息：遵守规则、计划下一步行动以及作为团队成员这些都是文章中提到的游戏理念，而交朋友并不是文章在这一段提到的内容。
(2) 句意理解题。联系上下文，特别是紧跟在划线部分后面的“教会孩子们一些他们一生都要遵循的基本规则，比如轮流和团队精神。”，可以推知游戏能够转化生活经验，教授孩子们重要的生活技能。
(3) 细节理解题。从段落中挖掘信息，文章提及对于遭受自然灾害或战争的国家而言，奥林匹克金牌胜利具有重要意义，是整个国家的胜利，而不仅仅是个人的荣誉。
(4) 细节理解题。通过比对选项和文中相关信息，可以找到与每个选项相符合的证据，除了B项。因为文章中提到全世界的人们踢足球，有的是为了娱乐，也有的是为了谋生。
(5) 主旨大意题。整篇文章通过讨论不同的游戏和运动及其影响，着重强调了游戏与现实生活的联系以及对个人和国家层面的重要性。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: Grace, David, Jenny and Paul are good friends. Grace and David are in New Star Middle School, while Jenny and Paul are in Xinhua Middle School. They are in different classes. Jenny is 12 years old, and Paul is one year older than Jenny. They each have their own rooms with many things in them. Look, Grace's English dictionary is on her bed, and her jackets are on the bed, too. Where are her keys? Oh, they are in her schoolbag. What about David's room? His pens, erasers, pencils, and rulers are in his pencil box, and his school ID card is in his schoolbag, which is on the desk. Jenny's books are everywhere: on the table, on the sofa, on her chair, and under her chair. Her jackets are on the table. "Where is my watch?" she often asks her parents. What about Paul? His books are in the bookcase, his black jacket is on the sofa, and his keys are on the sofa, too.

(1) 题目内容: How old is Paul? 选项: A. 12. B. 13. C. 14. D. 15.

(2) 题目内容: What can we know from the first paragraph? 选项: A. Grace and David are schoolmates. B. Jenny is not a middle school student. C. Jenny and Paul are sister and brother. D. Grace is twelve years old.

(3) 题目内容: Who is tidy? 选项: A. Grace. B. David. C. Paul. D. Jenny.

(4) 题目内容: Why does Jenny often ask her parents about her watch? 选项: A. Because she wants to get a new one. B. Because she can't find her watch. C. Because she thinks her watch is in her parents' room. D. Because her parents ask her for it.
ques_analyze: 【分析】本文是一篇记叙文，主要描述了Grace, David, Jenny和Paul四个学生的一些简单信息和他们房间的摆设。 (1)这是一个推理判断题。文章中指出Jenny的年龄为12岁，而Paul比Jenny大一岁。通过简单计算 12岁 + 1岁 = 13岁，我们得知Paul的年龄为13岁，因此选择B。 (2)这是一个细节判断题。文章清楚地提到Grace和David就读于新星中学，这表明他们在同一所学校，也就是校友。故我们选择A，表示Grace和David是校友。 (3)这是一个推理判断题。从文中对David房间的描述我们可以看出，David的笔、橡皮、铅笔和尺子都整齐地放在笔盒里，学生证放在书包里，书包又放在桌上。这些细节显示出David有条理，因此我们认为他是比较整洁的，选择B。 (4)这是一个推理判断题。文章说明Jenny的书籍散落在各处，她的夹克也在桌上。因为Jenny的物品到处都是，她经常找不到手表，因此常问她的父母。所以我们选择B，表示她之所以经常问父母关于她的手表在哪里，是因为她找不到手表。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Looking at the traffic and crowds in Guanggu Square, one of the busiest places in Wuhan, Hubei Province, Zhao Bin realized that the city had finally recovered from the pandemic. Zhao Bin is a food deliveryman in Wuhan. During the days when the COVID-19 broke out, he and other local deliverymen worked day and night with no time off and often forgot about meals. The virus wouldn’t let him and the others have a rest. “People needed us,” he said. During the pandemic, due to the shortage of supplies in Wuhan, deliverymen had to search all stores around to prepare orders. “It was the busiest time I had ever seen as a food deliveryman,” Zhao said. “It’s so tiring, but I feel what I did was valued.” One of the biggest changes that Zhao Bin has noticed is that customers now show more respect and understanding toward food delivery workers. “Before the pandemic, customers didn’t understand why delivery was late on rainy days,” Zhao said. “But after the pandemic, they text us to let us know it’s fine if we’re running late.” Zhao loves taking pictures of people since he spends most of his time on the street. He said he took up photography as a hobby after working as a museum security guard. He believes no matter how heavy the daily work is, people still need dreams and hobbies. One of his wishes during the pandemic was to get a picture of people hugging on the street, he said. And now, the dream has come true. “My beloved Wuhan is back,” he said. (1) 题目内容: What does the word “送餐员” mean? 选项: A. 记者 B. 客服代表 C. 安全员 D. 送餐员 (2) 题目内容: Why did Zhao Bin work day and night when the COVID-19 broke out? 选项: A. 因为他想赚更多的钱。 B. 因为他需要更多食物。 C. 因为武汉人太懒，懒得出去。 D. 因为疫情需要送餐员给武汉人送食物。 (3) 题目内容: How did Zhao Bin feel about his job during the pandemic? 选项: A. 激动。 B. 无聊。 C. 有价值。 D. 有趣。 (4) 题目内容: Which of the following is WRONG according to the passage? 选项: A. 光谷广场是武汉最繁忙的地方之一。 B. 在疫情期间，对送餐员来说有足够的订单。 C. 顾客以前不理解为什么雨天送餐会迟到。 D. 赵斌拍到了街上人们拥抱的照片。 (5) 题目内容: What does this passage try to tell us? 选项: A. why a deliveryman worked so hard during the pandemic. B. 送餐员在疫情期间的爱好。 C. 送餐员在疫情期间的工作情况。 D. 人们如何误解送餐员。
ques_analyze:
(1) 考查词义猜测。根据信息“赵斌是一名武汉的送餐员。他和其他本地送餐员昼夜不停地工作，没有休息时间，经常忘记吃饭。” 我们可以推断，在新冠疫情期间，他和其他送餐人员需要日夜工作，没有休息时间，常常忘记吃饭。通过文中的描述，推测出“送餐员”是指负责送餐的人员，即‘送餐员’选择D。
(2) 细节理解题。文章提到“在疫情期间，由于武汉供应短缺，送餐员们需要到处搜寻商店以准备订单。” 表明由于武汉物资短缺，送餐工作变得更为必要，故选D。
(3) 细节理解题。文章中赵表示“虽然很累，但我觉得所做的一切是有价值的。” 说明他尽管工作很累却觉得自己的努力是有价值的，因此选择C。
(4) 推理判断题。“在疫情期间，他的一个愿望是拍到街上人们拥抱的照片。” 只是表明他有拍摄拥抱的人的愿望，并不意味着已实现，故选择B。
(5) 主旨大意题。全文通过赵斌的例子，说明了疫情期间送餐人员的工作情况。正确答案为C，体现文章主旨。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Hi, Kate! I saw your name and address in Pen-friend magazine, and I would like to be your pen-friend. First, I will tell you some things about myself. My name is Sidney, Li Peichun. I'm fourteen years old. I'm about five feet tall. I have short black hair and brown eyes. My hobbies are playing computer games and playing chess. I live with my parents. They came to England about 30 years ago. They came from Hong Kong. Now my parents own a Chinese restaurant in Newcastle. We live in a small house near our restaurant. I was born in Newcastle. I can speak Chinese, but I cannot write it very well. I have a brother called Edwin. He is 23 and works as an architect in London. I'm in Walker School. It is near my house, so I can walk to school. I like my school because the teachers are friendly. My school has several sports fields. I like sports very much. I enjoy playing rugby and badminton in winter, and tennis in summer. My favorite subject is physics. I want to be an engineer. I'll send you a photo of myself with my school friends. I am in the middle. I hope you will write to me soon, and tell me all about you. (1) 题目内容: Sidney wants __. 选项: A. to tell Kate about his family B. to make friends with Kate C. to practice his English D. to tell Kate about his school life (2) 题目内容: How many people are there in Sidney's family? 选项: A. 2. B. 3. C. 4. D. 5. (3) 题目内容: Where was Sidney born? 选项: A. In China. B. In England. C. In Canada. D. In Japan. (4) 题目内容: What's Sidney's favorite sport in winter? 选项: A. Tennis. B. Computer games. C. Badminton. D. Chess.
ques_analyze:
文中的Sidney, 李沛纯想要与Kate建立笔友关系，并介绍了自己的个人信息，包括他的姓名、年龄、家庭和学校等。解答各个问题时：
(1) 题目解析: 需要判断Sidney的意图。他在文章开头就提到了'你好，Kate！我在《笔友》杂志上看到了你的名字和地址，想与你成为笔友。'，表明他希望交朋友，因此答案为B。
(2) 题目解析: 询问Sidney家庭成员数量。通过'我和父母住在一起……我有一个叫Edwin的哥哥'可知家中共有四个人，包括他的父母、哥哥和他自己，因此答案为C。
(3) 题目解析: 询问Sidney出生地。根据'我出生在纽卡斯尔'可知他出生于英国的纽卡斯尔，因此答案为B。
(4) 题目解析: 询问Sidney冬季最喜欢的运动是什么。通过'冬天我喜欢打橄榄球和羽毛球'可知他在冬季最喜欢的是羽毛球。因此答案为C。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Become a Scholastic News Kid Reporter Thank you for your interest in becoming a Scholastic News kid reporter! To be considered, you must be 10 years old by May 1, 2020, and between the ages of 10 and 14, and submit all of the following materials: ● A typed news article (400 words at most) about a person or an organization making a positive impact in your community. ● A typed essay (250 words at most) that answers the questions: Why do you want to be a kid reporter? What do you hope to learn as a kid reporter? ● Two ideas for stories about your community that you would like to work on as a kid reporter. ● A basic background information form that lets the editors know more about you. ● A student release form provided by Scholastic News, which must be completed and signed by your parents. ● A recent photo of yourself. If you are chosen as a kid reporter, it will appear on the Scholastic News website when we announce the new kid reporters in early May. The photo can be a color print or an original photo, and we will not return any photos submitted. Send all the above materials to: Scholastic News Kids Press Corps/Apply 557 Broadway New York, NY 100212-3999 Have questions about the application? Send an email to kidspress@scholastic.com. All applications must be sent by March 25th, 2020. NO LATE APPLICATIONS WILL BE ACCEPTED (1) 题目内容：年龄为__的孩子可以申请成为小记者。选项：A. 在2020年6月1日满10岁的孩子 B. 11岁的孩子 C. 15岁的孩子 D. 未满9岁的孩子 (2) 题目内容：学生授权书必须由__签署。选项：A. 孩子自己 B. 孩子的学校 C. 孩子的父母 D. 孩子的老师 (3) 题目内容：根据文章，我们可以知道__。选项：A. 短文的字数上限是400字 B. 逾期的申请也会被考虑 C. 每个孩子需要提交两个社区报道想法 D. 结果将在五月于网站上公布 (4) 题目内容：如果对申请有疑问，你可以__。选项：A. 拨打100212-3999 B. 访问《学乐新闻》小记者团 C. 写信至《学乐新闻》小记者团 D. 发送电子邮件至kidspress@scholastic.com (5) 题目内容：这篇文章主要是写给__的。选项：A. 父母 B. 学校 C. 孩子 D. 记者
ques_analyze:
本文详细介绍了成为《学乐新闻》小记者的申请要求和流程。
(1) 根据文中“年龄在10至14岁之间，其中B项符合标准为11岁的儿童，因此答案是B。
(2) 在申请过程中，“学生授权书必须由父母签署”，因此答案是C。
(3) 关于申请结果公布时间，“五月初在网站上宣布新小记者”，因此答案是D。
(4) 若对申请有疑问，“发送电子邮件至kidspress@scholastic.com”，因此答案是D。
(5) 文章主要描述了孩子如何申请成为小记者，目标读者为儿童，因此答案是C。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: 阅读短文，作出选择。Read the passages and make your choice. Video games are highly popular. The desire to win makes it hard to stop playing, whether competing against the computer or a friend. The phrase 'just one more game' often leads to multiple games. Video games do have benefits. They are great for improving hand-eye coordination. Surgeons today who played video games in their childhood are often more adept than those who didn't. Video games can also be effective educational tools. Students learn while playing and can engage for longer periods compared to traditional teaching methods. They can learn at their own pace without the pressure to keep up with peers, and the adage 'practice makes perfect' applies here too. However, balance is key. Excessive time spent on video games can strain your eyes. Regular breaks are necessary. If students can't limit their gaming, other areas of their lives will suffer—not just academics but also essential social skills like communication and teamwork. Lack of physical activity can also negatively impact their health. Video games have their place, but it's important to lead a balanced life. (1) 题目内容: Video games are beneficial because__.选项: A. they enhance hand dexterity B. they can completely replace teachers C. they improve vision D. computers are inexpensive  (2) 题目内容: Surgeons who played video games as kids might__.选项: A. be less skilled surgeons B. be more skilled surgeons C. show no difference D. enjoy surgeries  (3) 题目内容: Which is not a drawback of video games?选项: A. Impact on health B. Impact on social skills C. Impact on hand-eye coordination D. Impact on vision
ques_analyze: (1) This question examines the positive effects of video games based on the passage. According to the second paragraph, 'Video games do have benefits. They are great for improving hand-eye coordination,' it is clear that one of the advantages of video games is improving hand dexterity. Therefore, option A is correct.

(2) This question tests understanding of the passage details. The second paragraph mentions, 'Surgeons today who played video games in their childhood are often more adept than those who didn't,' indicating that children who played video games might become more skilled surgeons. Hence, option B is the correct answer.

(3) This question requires identifying which is not a disadvantage of video games. The passage starts by stating that video games are beneficial for improving hand-eye coordination, showing that option C (impact on hand-eye coordination) is actually an advantage, not a drawback. So, the correct answer is C.

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: Have you ever played King of Glory （《王者荣耀》）? If you have, what are your thoughts on the game? Li Ming, a 13-year-old student from Shanghai, began putting most of his free time into playing King of Glory last May. "All the boys in my class are hooked on it," he stated. "Top players earn respect." King of Glory has grown to be an extraordinarily popular mobile game in China, amassing 50 million daily users. Setting itself apart from other games, King of Glory uses names of historical <u>characters</u> from Chinese history for all its heroes. "They all look very cool," commented Li, who particularly likes the character Jing Ke. "She’s really beautiful," he noted. Interestingly, the real Jing Ke was a man, but in the game, the character is a woman. Jing Ke is not alone in this. Historical poet Li Bai becomes a killer in the game, and Bian Que, China’s first known doctor, not only heals but also poisons his enemies. This has sparked intense debate. Some parents fear the game might confuse their children. An article has criticized the game for distorting China's history. Others are not as concerned and consider it just a game. They argue the real issue is the absence of a game rating system in China. King of Glory is designed for people aged 16 and above, yet more than 30 percent of its players are primary or middle school students who may struggle to differentiate fact from fiction.

(1) 题目内容: How old was Li Ming when he first started playing King of Glory?  
选项: A. Ten years old B. Eleven years old C. Twelve years old D. Thirteen years old  

(2) 题目内容: What is the meaning of the underlined word 'characters' in paragraph 2?  
选项: A. 数字 B. 目标 C. 影像 D. 人物  

(3) 题目内容: What role does Li Bai play in King of Glory according to the article?  
选项: A. Student B. Killer C. Physician D. Game developer  

(4) 题目内容: How does the author suggest resolving the problem mentioned in the article?  
选项: A. By removing all historically inaccurate characters from King of Glory. B. By restricting access to King of Glory for those under 16. C. By establishing a proper game rating system in China. D. By incorporating history lessons within King of Glory.  

(5) 题目内容: According to the passage, which of the following statements about King of Glory is NOT true?  
选项: A. Bian Que in the game has been gender-swapped to a woman. B. The game features characters named after figures from Chinese history. C. Li Ming likes Jing Ke because of her beauty. D. More than 15 million daily users are primary or middle school students.
ques_analyze:
【解析优化】
(1) 根据文章第二段内容，Li Ming从去年五月开始玩王者荣耀，当时他13岁。因此，他应从12岁开始玩该游戏，选项C正确。
(2) 词义推测题。上下文提到《王者荣耀》中的所有角色都以中国历史人物命名，这里的'characters'指的是'人物'，故选D。
(3) 根据第三段内容，李白在游戏中的角色是击杀敌人，这对应的选项是'killer'，因此选B。
(4) 文章最后部分指出，问题在于中国缺乏游戏评价制度，因此需要建立游戏评级制度来解决问题，故选C。
(5) 细节判断题。文章提到荆轲被改编成女性角色，而不是扁鹊。因此A项错误，选A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Some kids love computer games and spend too much time on them. They often hear Mom or Dad shout at them, "Enough! <u>Turn off</u> the computer and find some other things to do!" Their parents are right, why? If you always play computer games, you won't get enough exercise, so you may become fat. And if you spend too much time playing computer games, you'll have less time to make friends or do your homework. What's more, if you play computer games too often, you may get angry easily and fight with others often. But here's the good news: Playing computer games for a short time can be relaxing. Just choose some good games and spend no more than one hour a day. Play the games for your age. You can play with your mom, dad or even your grandma together. It's a good way to relax. (1) 题目内容: The underlined phrase "关掉" means "__" in Chinese.选项: A. 出售 B. 关闭 C. 修理 D. 移动  (2) 题目内容: What does the second paragraph tell us?选项: A. 父母总是对的。 B. 我们必须花更多时间做作业。 C. 如何在网上交朋友。 D. 为什么电脑游戏对我们有害。  (3) 题目内容: According to the passage, how long can you play computer games a day?选项: A. 不超过一小时。 B. 两个半小时。 C. 三小时。 D. 五小时。
ques_analyze: 文章大意：文章主要讨论了过度玩电脑游戏可能带来的负面影响，以及适量游戏的积极作用。(1) 词义猜测题，通过“去做点别的事情吧”的提示，可以推测出“关掉”指的是停止当前的活动，因此选项B“关闭”是正确答案。(2) 段落大意题，综合第二段对过度玩游戏带来负面影响的描述，可以得出选项D为正确答案。(3) 细节理解题，根据文章中的提示“每天玩不超过一小时”可以得出正确答案为A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Guitar Player Wanted Are you a lover of music? Can you play the guitar? Can you sing or dance? Join our Sunshine Rock Band. Please call Mike at 5487-6598 or send an email to sunshine@yahoo.com. Hot Club Do you like to play table tennis? Do you want to play it well? Mr. Zhang is a good teacher. You can come here every Saturday afternoon from 2:30 to 5:30. Telephone number: 8665-7868 Address: Room 15, Lantian Hotel Swimmer Wanted Can you swim? Do you like children?
