My sister and I are in Luoyang, Henan Province with them. I’m 13 years old. I'm a student in Grade Seven. I like my teachers and my friends in China. They are friendly. They often help me. I want to be a Chinese doctor when I grow up. Now I can speak Chinese. My sister, Jane, is only three years old. She is very cute. She has brown hair and blue eyes. We all love her. China is very beautiful. Welcome to China. Yours, Frank (1) 题目内容: How many people are there in Frank’s family? 选项: A. Four B. Six C. Three D. Five (2) 题目内容: The letter is from __ to __. 选项: A. Jane; Frank B. Bill; Jane C. Frank; Bill D. Bill; Frank (3) 题目内容: What color is Jane’s hair? 选项: A. It’s yellow. B. It’s brown. C. It’s black. D. It’s blue. (4) 题目内容: The underlined phrase “grow up” means “__” in Chinese. 选项: A. 放弃 B. 捡起 C. 长大 D. 起床 (5) 题目内容: Which of the following is TRUE? 选项: A. Frank is a Chinese boy. B. Frank’s grandparents are teachers. C. Frank’s sister is 3 years old. D. Frank’s parents work in China now.
ques_analyze:
根据文章内容，我们可以按照以下思路进行分析：
(1) 细节理解题。文章提及“我的祖父母是办公室职员”、“我的父母都是老师”以及“我姐姐和我都在河南省洛阳市和父母在一起”，明确告知家庭成员有祖父母、父母、妹妹和弗兰克自己，共六人。
(2) 细节理解题。信的开头是“亲爱的比尔”，结尾落款为“弗兰克”，因此可以确定信是由弗兰克写给比尔的。
(3) 细节理解题。信中有明确描述“简...有棕色的头发和蓝色的眼睛”，表明简的头发颜色为棕色。
(4) 词义猜测题。在句子“我长大后想成为一名中医”中，“长大”显然指的是长大成人，即他长大后想成为一名中医。
(5) 推理判断题。通过“弗兰克的父母是教师，在洛阳国际学校教英语。他和妹妹也在洛阳和父母一起生活”的信息可知，弗兰克的父母目前在中国洛阳工作。
结合以上分析，可以得出各题的正确答案。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: Why play games? Because they are fun, and a lot more besides. Following the rules, planning your next move, acting as a team member—these are all “game” ideas that you will have throughout your life. Think about some of the games you played as a young child, such as rope-jumping and hide-and-seek. Some games are entertaining and fun. But perhaps more importantly, they teach children some of the basic rules they will be expected to follow the rest of their lives, such as taking turns and teamwork. Many children’s games have a practical side. Children around the world play games that prepare them for work they will do as adults. For example, some Saudi Arabian children play a game called bones. It can be very helpful to exercise their hands and eyes, which is needed in hunting. Many sports encourage national or local pride. The most famous games of all, the Olympic Games, bring athletes from around the world together to take part in the friendly competition. People who watch the event wave flags, knowing that a gold medal is a win for a whole country, not just the athlete who has got it. For countries experiencing natural disasters or war, an Olympic win can mean so much. Sports are also an event that brings people together. Soccer is the most popular sport in the world. People on all continents play it—some for fun and some for a living. Nicolette Iribarne, a Californian soccer player, has discovered a way to spread hope through soccer. He set up an organization which can provide poor children with not only soccer balls but also a hopeful future. Next time, when you play your favorite game or sport, think about why you enjoy it, what skills are needed, and whether these skills will help you in your life. 

(1) 题目内容: The underlined part “<u>将生活转化为激动人心的梦想</u>” in Paragraph 2 most probably means that games can __. 选项: A. describe life in an exciting way B. turn real-life experiences into a play C. change people’s views of sporting events D. teach children something useful and important 

(2) 题目内容: What does the underlined word “<u>它</u>” in Paragraph 4 refer to? 选项: A. The whole country. B. The gold medal. C. The event. D. The game. 

(3) 题目内容: According to the passage, why is winning Olympic medals so encouraging? 选项: A. It means a lot for a whole country. B. It proves how excellent the winners are. C. It helps the country out of natural disasters. D. It brings the winners satisfaction and money. 

(4) 题目内容: Which of the following statements is NOT true? 选项: A. The most famous games are the Olympic Games. B. People around the world play soccer just for fun. C. The game called bones can be helpful to the Arabian children. D. Nicolette Iribarne gives poor children a chance for a better life. 

(5) 题目内容: What is the passage mainly about? 选项: A. The popular games. B. Games and real life. C. The advantages of games. D. Children’s games and the future.
ques_analyze:
【解析】(1) 根据第二段的描述，特别是'on basic rules they will be expected to follow'这一句，可以推断出游戏可以教会孩子们一些重要的生活准则。故正确答案是D。
(2) 要确定“it”指的是什么，需要查看上下文。上文提到金牌不仅是运动员个人的胜利，更是整个国家的荣耀，因此“it”指的是金牌。故正确答案是B。
(3) 从文章第四段末尾判断，对于经历自然灾害或战争的国家来说，赢得奥运会奖牌意义重大。这表明奥运会奖牌对一个国家的激励作用。故正确答案是A。
(4) 根据文章内容，A、C和D都是准确的陈述，因为它们都在文章中得到了验证。而B项中提到世界各地的人只是为了娱乐而踢足球则是不准确的，文中也提到有些人踢足球是为了生计。故正确答案是B。
(5) 全文讲述了游戏及运动不仅具有娱乐性，还有助于学习基本生活技能及团队协作等重要理念，并展示了它们在世界文化及人类生活中的重要性。因此，文章主要讨论了游戏与现实生活的关系。故正确答案是B。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容:    Many people like animals. Now, many people keep animals as pets. Usually, people like to keep dogs, cats, fish, and other animals. Many young people think these animals are interesting, so they like to keep pets. Some old people keep pets because they don’t live with their children. I have a cousin. His name is Ken, and he lives at No. 25 Garden Street in London. He is a doctor, but he only helps dogs. People usually call him The Dog Doctor. When their dogs get sick, they call him on the telephone. He goes to people’s houses by car and helps them, so he is very busy every day. He gives the dogs the right medicine. He always says, "I love dogs. I love animals. Helping animals makes me happy because they are our best friends." Wherever he goes, he is always popular. (1) 题目内容: Many young people like animals because they think these animals are __. 选项: A. 无聊 B. 有趣 C. 糟糕 D. 善良 (2) 题目内容: Why do old people keep pets? 选项: A. 因为他们不喜欢孩子。 B. 因为他们没有孩子。 C. 因为他们觉得动物有趣。 D. 因为他们不和孩子住在一起。 (3) 题目内容: What does the underlined word "sick" mean in Chinese? 选项: A. 饥饿的 B. 开心的 C. 生病的 D. 温顺的 (4) 题目内容: How does Ken go to people’s houses? 选项: A. 乘公交车 B. 开车 C. 坐地铁 D. 乘火车 (5) 题目内容: What does the writer’s cousin do? 选项: A. 他是一名教师。 B. 他是一名工人。 C. 他是一名医生。 D. 他是一名作家。
ques_analyze:
这些问题都是基于一篇关于动物和宠物的文章的阅读理解题。我们逐个进行分析：
(1) 第一个问题询问年轻人为什么喜欢动物。直接引用文章中的句子表明年轻人认为这些动物很有趣，“很多年轻人觉得这些动物很有趣” 因此答案是 B.
(2) 第二个问题询问老年人为什么养宠物。文中提到“而一些老年人则因为不与孩子同住而养宠物” 意味着老年人养宠物是因为他们不与子女同住，所以答案是 D.
(3) 第三个问题是对文中下划线词“生病”的理解。结合文中提到肯给狗狗药物的行为“他给狗狗开正确的药物”，可以推断“生病”意味着“生病的”，所以正确答案是 C.
(4) 第四个问题是关于肯如何去到人们家中的。根据文章，“他开车去人们家中”表明他驾车前往，因此答案 B 是正确的。
(5) 最后一个问题是关于作者表哥的职业。直接从文章中可以找到证据“他是一名医生”，这表明作者的表哥是一位医生，所以正确答案是 C。
通过具体解析，我们可以看见题目答案与文章内容相对应，合理且正确。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Simple arithmetic operations can lead to interesting results in number games. Here is an intriguing trick; just follow the steps and discover the mystery. First, write down your house number. For example, if your address is 82 Maple Street, you would write down 82. Next, double this number. Then add 7 to this result. Here, if your address is 82, doubling it gives 164, and adding 7 gives 171. The third step is to multiply this result by 40. In this example, 171 multiplied by 40 gives 6840. The next step is to add your age to the total. Suppose you are 25 years old, then add 25 to 6840, resulting in 6865. The following step is to add 365, the number of days in a year. Thus, 6865 plus 365 equals 7230. The final step is to subtract 600. In our example, 7230 minus 600 equals 6630. The final result, 6630, contains your house number and your age. For example, the house number is 82, and the age is 25; the result shows 82 as the house number and 30 as the age. Isn’t it interesting? Would you like to try it yourself? (1) 题目内容: How many steps are there in this trick? 选项: A. Five B. Six C. Eight (2) 题目内容: The third step is __. 选项: A. +7 B. ×40 C. -600 (3) 题目内容: Li Hua is 25 years old and lives at 82 Maple Street. If he tries this trick, he will get __ in the end. 选项: A. 825 B. 7230 C. 6630 (4) 题目内容: In this trick, __ is Not the number you have to use every time. 选项: A. 365 B. 82 C. 40 (5) 题目内容: The best title of this passage is “__”. 选项: A. Number Game B. An Interesting Problem C. How to Solve a Trick
ques_analyze:
【解析优化】
1. 根据文章中的步骤描述，我们可以逐个分析每个步骤来确定总数：
初始步骤：写下门牌号。
第一步：将门牌号翻倍。
第二步：将结果加7。
第三步：将结果乘以40。
第四步：将你的年龄加到总数中。
第五步：加上365天。
最终步骤：从总数中减去600。
总共是六个步骤。

2. 第三步，根据文章描述，应当将结果乘以40。

3. 对李华来说，使用这个把戏，他首先将他的门牌号82翻倍得到164，然后根据步骤加上7，得到171，再将结果乘以40，得6840，随后加上他的年龄25，得到6865，接着加上一年的天数365，得7230，最后减去600，得到6630。

4. 现实中每个人的门牌号都可能不同，而文中82只是一个例子。因此，每次玩这个把戏都不一定使用82。

5. 整篇文章讨论的是一个利用数字的游戏，因此"数字游戏"作为最佳标题。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: ENJOY SUDOKU 4 3 5 2 6 9 7 8 1 6 8 2 5 7 1 4 9 3 1 9 7 8 3 4 5 6 2 8 2 6 1 9 5 3 4 7 X 3 9 7 4 8 2 1 6 1 6 4 3 7 8 9 2 5 9 7 1 5 6 3 4 Y 8 5 4 8 9 2 6 7 3 Z 2 5 3 4 1 7 6 8 9 7 1 9 6 8 4 2 5 3 Have you grown tired of your usual puzzles? Try Sudoku! Sudoku, derived from the Japanese words Su ('number') and Doku ('single'), was actually invented not by the Japanese, but by Howard Garnes in 1979. It was introduced in Japan by Nikoli Puzzle Company in 1984, and Kaji Maki, Nikoli's president, established clear rules in 1986. Sudoku quickly gained popularity in Japan and became a global sensation when The Times, a British newspaper, published it in November 2004. By 2005, Sudoku had captivated audiences worldwide. The goal of Sudoku is to fill in the blanks so that every row, column, and 3×3 box contains the numbers 1 to 9. Here’s a Sudoku puzzle for you to enjoy and unwind with. Answer the questions below based on the article above. (1) 题目内容: Who is the original inventor of Sudoku? 选项: A. Nikoli. B. Howard Garnes. C. Sudoku. D. Kaji Maki. (2) 题目内容: According to the text, which statement is correct regarding Kaji Maki? 选项: A. He popularized Sudoku in Japan. B. He founded Nikoli Puzzle Company. C. He created Sudoku. D. He was a journalist at The Times. (3) 题目内容: What is incorrect about Sudoku based on the article? 选项: A. Sudoku became widely recognized globally in 2005. B. The Times introduced Sudoku in a newspaper. C. Sudoku originated in Japan. D. Each square holds only one number. (4) 题目内容: In the Sudoku puzzle presented, what value should replace 'X'? 选项: A. 3. B. 4. C. 1. D. 5. (5) 题目内容: What number should be in place of 'Z' in the given puzzle? 选项: A. 5. B. 2. C. 4. D. 8.
ques_analyze:
【思维链1】- 理解题目要点：本文介绍了数独的起源、历史以及玩法。
【思维链2】- (1) 数独的原创者是Howard Garnes：根据文中信息'It was created by Howard Garnes in 1979.'，所以答案是B。
【思维链3】- (2) Kaji Maki使数独在日本流行：根据'In 1986, Kaji Maki, the president of Nikoli made the rules strict and clear. Soon in the same year Sudoku became popular in Japan.'可以看出，Kaji Maki帮助数独在日本流行，因此选A是正确的。
【思维链4】- (3) 数独的错误描述是其起源于日本：根据文章内容，数独并非源自日本，而是由Howard Garnes创造，故C项为错误陈述。
【思维链5】- (4) 根据数独规则找出'X'应该是1：符合数独规则，这里应该填1，因此答案是C。
【思维链6】- (5) 按规则推导得出'Z'应该是5：分析数独规则后发现，'Z' 应填 5，这样符合每行、每列和每个3x3盒子包含1到9的游戏规则，因此答案是A。
【思维链7】- 内容总结：以上所有问题均为细节理解题，重在理解文章整体信息和仔细提取关键内容。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: 'Jacks' is the name of a game that is popular among children. To play this game, you need a small ball and ten small metal objects called 'jacks'. The rules of the game are very simple. First, place the ten 'jacks' on the ground or floor. Toss the ball into the air, pick up one 'jack', and catch the ball. Keep the 'jack' in your hand and continue to pick up another 'jack' each time. You lose your turn if you fail to catch the ball, fail to pick up a 'jack', or drop any 'jacks' from your hand. Once you have picked up all ten 'jacks', try again, but this time pick up two 'jacks' at a time. This is, of course, more difficult. You lose your turn if you make any of the above three mistakes or if you fail to pick up two 'jacks' each time. 

(1) 题目内容: Playing 'Jacks' is an activity that is __. 选项: A. difficult for boys B. interesting for children C. challenging for girls D. attractive to old people 

(2) 题目内容: The word "toss" here means __. 选项: A. drop B. catch C. throw D. pick up 

(3) 题目内容: To complete the first and second parts of the game, you need to pick up 'jacks' __ times. 选项: A. ten times B. fifteen times C. twenty times D. thirty times 

(4) 题目内容: The 'jacks' are made of __. 选项: A. paper B. glass C. metal D. wood 

(5) 题目内容: After you pick up the first ten 'jacks', the game becomes more difficult because you must pick up __ at a time. 选项: A. two 'jacks' B. four 'jacks' C. three 'jacks' D. only one
ques_analyze: 【分析】这篇短文介绍了‘jacks’游戏的规则。该游戏在孩子们中流行，说明它对孩子们来说是有趣的。(1) 根据文章中'它在孩子们中很流行'推断出儿童喜欢这个游戏，因此它对他们来说是有趣的。故选B。 (2) 根据文章，游戏中需要'将球抛向空中'，这不是'放下(drop)'，'接住(catch)'或'拾起(pick up)'。故选C。(3) 要完成游戏的第一部分需要逐个拾起十个'jack'，第二部分每次拾起两个，所以一共需要拾起十次单个 'jack' 和五次两个 'jack'，共十五次。故答案为B。(4) 文章中提到'十个小金属物体'表明'jacks'是金属制成的。故选C。(5) 在游戏中，成功捡起第一个十个 'jack' 后，玩家需要每次捡起两个 'jack'，使得游戏的难度增加。故选A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: 阅读短文，判断正(T) 误(F)。 We are playing a hide-and-seek game. My name is Bill, where am I? I’m under the bed. My friends Tom and Tim are in the tree. My friend Eric is in a big case. My sister Gina is looking for us. 作答类型为T/F(对/错) 1. Bill is under the bed. 2. Tom and Tim are in the tree. 3. Eric is Bill’s brother. 4. Gina isn’t Bill’s sister. 5. There are five children playing hide-and-seek.
ques_analyze: 本题要求判断短文内容的正误。1. 根据短文内容'我在床下。'，可以看出Bill在床下，因此选择T。2. 根据'我的朋友Tom和Tim在树上。' 可以确定Tom和Tim在树上，所以选T。3. 文中的'Eric在一个大箱子里'没有提到Eric是Bill的兄弟，因此选F。4. 由于短文中提到'我的妹妹Gina在找我们'，所以可以断定Gina是Bill的妹妹，于是选F。5. 总览全文，提到的孩子有Bill、Tom、Tim、Eric和Gina，共5个，因此选择T。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: NEED A SUMMER JOB? Time: From June to August Who: Campers aged from four to thirteen (Campers are grouped by age: four to five, six to eight, and nine to thirteen) Where: Addison, Dallas, and Richardson Position: Camp Counselors for our Summer Science Day camp Requirements: Must be an SMU student who loves children and really wants to work with them. Patient, friendly, easy to work with, and punctual. What you can get: A lot of fun, valuable experience, and great money! We need you! Apply online and get more information at www.ClubScientificDallas.com. (1)题目内容: 夏令营的时间是__. 选项：A. 六月到八月 B. 七月到九月 C. 五月到六月 D. 八月到十月 (2)题目内容: 在夏令营中，辅导员将会__. 选项：A. 收获大量乐趣 B. 获得珍贵礼物 C. 几乎不赚钱 D. 出国旅游 (3)题目内容: 我们最有可能在哪里看到这个信息？ 选项：A. 在烹饪节目中 B. 在学生的日记中 C. 在购物网站上 D. 在学校通知中
ques_analyze: 阅读材料后，首先判断三个题目的细节：(1) 根据材料中的“时间：六月到八月”提示，明确了夏令营的举行时间为六月到八月，因此选择A。 (2) 分析“你可以得到：很多乐趣、宝贵经验和丰厚的报酬！”句子，从中得出，夏令营辅导员将享受乐趣，选择A。 (3) 考虑到“需为南卫理公会大学的学生，喜爱孩子且愿意与他们一起工作。”说明这是针对特定群体（南卫理公会大学学生）的招聘信息，因此推测最有可能在学校的公告中阅读到此材料，所以选择D。关键是捕捉细节信息并据此推断答案。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: News one: As the pace of life in big cities is getting faster, people are looking for more ways to relax. Let’s take a look at one way people are reducing stress in Beijing. The game is “Room Escape”. “Room Escape” was originally a computer game. In recent years, it has been adapted to a real life game. There are more than 10 places in Beijing where people can play this game. According to the rules, the players are first taken to a house with several iron doors. They then need to find a way out of the house in one hour. Different houses have different ways of escaping, all of which require players’ boldness, careful thought, and teamwork. News two: The Chinese government has published a list of 24 guidelines on how to take better care of parents. They are a modern update to 24 old stories about respectful children from the Yuan Dynasty. The guidelines list 24 things to do with parents, including giving them a call every week, teaching them to use the internet, and supporting single parents’ remarriage. The guidelines stem from a Yuan Dynasty book, about 24 filial-hearted children who treated their parents very well. It is a value younger generations should never forget. (1) 题目内容: Why do people play “Room Escape”?选项: A. For fun B. To know how clever they are C. To find out different ways of escaping D. To relax themselves (2) 题目内容: How long do they have to escape from the house?选项: A. In an hour B. In two hours C. In several hours D. In at least an hour (3) 题目内容: What do they not need to do to escape from the house?选项: A. Have a strong body B. Act fearfully C. Think carefully D. Work together (4) 题目内容: What should we not do to our parents?选项: A. Teach them to use the internet B. Often talk with them C. Ask them to marry again D. Treat them carefully (5) 题目内容: What does News Two tell us?选项: A. It asks us to read books from the Yuan Dynasty B. It asks us to give our parents money C. It asks us to respect our parents D. It asks us to give them a call
ques_analyze:
【分析】这段材料介绍了北京人通过玩“密室逃脱”游戏来减轻压力的方式，以及中国政府发布的关于如何更好关爱父母的指南。
(1) '密室逃脱'是人们在北京用于减压的方式之一，这可以从'让我们来看看北京人减压的一种方式'这句中得出，因此答案选D。
(2) 根据规则说明'他们需要在一小时内找到离开房子的办法'可知，参与者必须在一小时内逃离房子，所以答案选A。
(3) 根据描述‘所有这些都需要玩家的勇敢、细心思考和团队合作，而不是坚强的身体’,我们可以得知，逃离房子需要的是勇气、仔细的思考和团队合作，而不是强壮的体魄，因此答案为A。
(4) 对于如何待父母，最后一句‘支持单亲父母再婚’暗示了应该支持单亲父母再婚，而不是要求他们再婚。因此，选项C是不正确的做法，故选择C。
(5) 第二条新闻的核心是关于尊重和照顾父母，因此答案为C。
点评：理解文段细节并联系上下文即可解答这些问题。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Mr. Johnson is a teacher. He has a happy family. The man with glasses is his father, old Mr. Johnson. He is 72 years old, but he looks young. His mother, Mrs. Johnson, is a beautiful and kind woman. She is good at <u>cooking</u>. Now she is making chicken soup. His wife, Catherine, is also a teacher. They are in the same school. Catherine is young and beautiful. They have a son and a daughter. The son’s name is Jack. He is 12 years old and likes swimming very much. Now he is swimming in the swimming pool. Jack has a little sister named Jenny. She is too young to go to school. She likes playing with Kitty, a little cat. Look! She is drinking milk. The cat is looking at her. (1) 题目内容: How many people are there in Mr. Johnson’s family? 选项: A. 四个人 B. 六个人 C. 五个人 D. 七个人 (2) 题目内容: What’s the Chinese meaning of the underlined word “cooking”? 选项: A. 做饭 B. 剪纸 C. 栽花 D. 手工 (3) 题目内容: Catherine is Jenny’s __. 选项: A. 妈妈 B. 妻子 C. 姐姐 D. 女儿 (4) 题目内容: Where is Jack? 选项: A. 在他的房间里 B. 在学校 C. 在客厅 D. 在游泳池 (5) 题目内容: Jenny likes __. 选项: A. 学数学 B. 和朋友玩耍 C. 玩球 D. 和她的猫玩
ques_analyze: 【分析】本文介绍了约翰逊先生和他的家庭成员，以及他们各自的爱好和当前的活动。(1) 根据文中提到的家庭成员：'戴眼镜的那个人是他的父亲'，'他的母亲约翰逊夫人'，'他的妻子凯瑟琳'，以及有一儿一女，可以明确约翰逊先生的家庭共有六个成员，故选B。(2) 词汇理解题。从'约翰逊夫人在做鸡汤'可以得出，'烹饪'意指'做饭'，故选A。(3) 细节判断题。从'他的妻子凯瑟琳'和'他们有一个儿子和一个女儿...她是珍妮'得出凯瑟琳是珍妮的妈妈，故选A。(4) 根据'现在他正在游泳池里游泳'可以判断杰克在游泳池里，故选D。(5) 通过'她喜欢和一只小猫——基蒂玩耍'可知珍妮喜欢和猫咪玩耍，故选D。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: True love, only for the country—this is a sentence from the diary of Chen Xiangrong, a 19-year-old Chinese soldier who was stationed at the border of Galwan Valley. Unluckily, Chen died during a border clash between Chinese and Indian army in June 2020. Last June, Indian army illegally crossed to the Chinese side of the Galwan Valley and set up tents, which forced the Chinese army to react, Xinhua reported. Qi Fabao, 41, with several of his soldiers tried to talk with the Indian side, but they got hit by Indian soldiers with rocks and other things. Chen Hongjun, 33, Chen Xiangrong, 19, Wang Zhuoran, 24, and Xiao Siyuan, 24, died during the fight. Qi was the only one left alive, but was badly hurt. It was the first time China let us know about the names of the dead soldiers since the fight happened. According to China, the Indian side did wrong in the Galwan Valley clash. On Feb 19, the Central Military Commission (CMC) honored one officer and four soldiers who kept the border safe. Four of them got awards after they died. The awards include honorary titles and first-class merit. In China, an honorary title is the highest award for a soldier. A first-class merit is the second-highest. The country also gave money to the four soldiers’ families. A team will stay in touch with the family members and help them if needed. The four soldiers’ children will also get more points in the college entrance examination. (1) 题目内容: The border clash happened because __. 选项: A. a Chinese soldier died B. Indian soldiers lost many tents C. Chinese army were training in the valley D. Indian soldiers illegally crossed the border (2) 题目内容: The Chinese soldiers planned to __ at first. 选项: A. fight the Indian soldiers with rocks B. make the clash more serious C. discuss the clash peacefully D. help Indian soldiers (3) 题目内容: Which of the following is TRUE? 选项: A. China showed great honor for the four soldiers. B. The four soldiers got honorary titles before they died. C. People in our country raised money for four soldiers’ families. D. The four soldiers’ children can go to any of China’s top universities. (4) 题目内容: The passage above is probably from __. 选项: A. a notice B. a storybook C. a diary D. a newspaper
ques_analyze:
本文是一篇新闻报道，主要内容是去年六月中印边境冲突的情况以及今年中央军委对在冲突中表现突出的士兵的表彰。
(1) 题目解析: 细节理解题。通过阅读可知，此次边境冲突是因为“Indian army illegally crossed to the Chinese side of the Galwan Valley and set up tents”，即因为印军非法越界造成的。故选择答案D。
(2) 题目解析: 细节理解题。根据文中“Qi Fabao, 41, with several of his soldiers tried to talk with the Indian side”可知，中方士兵最初试图与印方进行和平对话。故选择答案C。
(3) 题目解析: 推理判断题。从文中提及的“On Feb 19, the Central Military Commission (CMC) honored one officer and four soldiers who kept the border safe...In China, an honorary title is the highest award for a soldier”，可推断中国对这四位士兵表现出极大的敬意。因此，A选项“China showed great honor for the four soldiers”是正确的。故选择答案A。
(4) 题目解析: 标题归纳题。文章内容和语言风格表明，这段文字是一篇新闻报道，它出自一个新闻机构，比如新华社的报道。“Xinhua said”在文中明确提到，进一步确认了这一点。新闻报道通常发表在报纸上。故选择答案D。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Happy Farm is an online game that is very popular in China. At the beginning of the game, you get a piece of empty land and some seeds. You are like a farmer. If your land is small, you can spend money to make it bigger. You must harvest your crops on time, or other farmers will steal your fruits, vegetables, milk, eggs, and so on. Of course, you can steal theirs too. If you want to make money, you must sell your crops. Some Chinese websites offer this game to their users. It is said that so far, about 16 million Chinese people are playing this game. Some people are so crazy that they even get up in the middle of the night to harvest their crops and steal others'. Happy Farm brings happiness to people; it is truly a fascinating game. But it also brings some problems. It is reported that a baby died in a hospital just because the doctor didn’t give him timely treatment. Do you know what the doctor was doing? He was playing Happy Farm! There are many stories like this. (1) 题目内容: According to this passage, what is very popular in China? 选项: A. The farmer B. Happy Farm C. The Chinese website D. The Doctor (2) 题目内容: What is the correct order to play Happy Farm? a. Plant some crops. b. Harvest your crops on time. c. Sell your things. d. Get land and some seeds. 选项: A. d-b-c-a B. a-d-c-b C. d-a-b-c D. c-d-a-b (3) 题目内容: Many people are so involved in the game Happy Farm that they get up in the middle of the night __. 选项: A. to harvest and steal crops B. to chat with others C. to sell their things D. to read news about this game (4) 题目内容: What does the writer think of this game? 选项: A. It is not interesting at all. B. People shouldn’t be crazy about it. C. People must get up early to steal crops. D. People may play it when they are at work.
ques_analyze: (1) 根据文章第一段，Happy Farm在中国非常受欢迎。因此，正确答案为B。 (2) 打开游戏时，首先获得土地和一些种子，然后种植作物，定时收获，最终出售产品以赚钱，对应选项C：d-a-b-c，即先获得土地和种子，然后种植作物，定时收获，最后出售产品。 (3) 文章提到，人们为了收获作物甚至会在半夜起床，并有可能会偷窃他人的农作物，所以正确答案是A。 (4) 文章列举了医生忙于玩游戏而忽视病患治疗的负面案例，显示作者认为人们对该游戏的迷恋应该有所节制，因此答案B是正确的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: My name is Bill. I'd like to join your team. I'm great with children and believe we can be good friends. I enjoy sports—I can swim, perform Chinese Kung Fu, and play soccer and table tennis. I'm particularly good at playing table tennis. Additionally, I'm interested in music, and I can play both the guitar and the drums. I believe I can assist kids with swimming, Chinese Kung Fu, soccer, table tennis, and music. I can also help them with computer skills, as I spend a lot of time on the computer. (1) 题目内容: Bill believes __.选项: A. He can be a good student B. He and the children can be close friends C. He can become a musician D. He can play chess (2) 题目内容: How many different sports does Bill participate in?选项: A. One. B. Two. C. Three. D. Four. (3) 题目内容: Bill is particularly skilled at __.选项: A. Playing the guitar B. Swimming C. Playing table tennis D. Practicing Chinese Kung Fu (4) 题目内容: Bill is unable to assist children with __.选项: A. Chinese Kung Fu B. Music C. Computers D. Mathematics
ques_analyze:
【分析】本文是一篇Bill的自我介绍，重点描述Bill的兴趣和技能。
(1) 细节理解题。Bill表示他愿意和孩子们成为好朋友（'I believe we can be good friends'），所以他认为他和孩子们可以成为好朋友，故选B。
(2) 细节理解题。Bill提到了他参加的运动项目有游泳、中国功夫、足球和乒乓球，总共四项（'I can swim, perform Chinese Kung Fu, and play soccer and table tennis'），因此答案是四项，故选D。
(3) 细节理解题。Bill提到他非常擅长打乒乓球（'I'm particularly good at playing table tennis'），故此问题的正确答案是打乒乓球，选C。
(4) 推理判断题。根据Bill提到的他能帮助孩子们的内容（游泳、中国功夫、足球、乒乓球、音乐和电脑），没有提到数学，故选D。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: I am Alice, a student at Sayville Middle School in London. Our school is spacious and beautiful, with 500 boys and 689 girls, aged between 13 and 19. The buildings in our school are newly built. Each classroom has two large blackboards, a television, and five computers, which help us a lot. I particularly like the school library, which has many books. I often read books there with my friends. If you can't find the book you need, please ask the teachers in the library for help; they are all very friendly. I also like the dining hall, which has many tables and chairs, large televisions, and ping-pong tables. We can watch TV and play ping-pong in the dining hall. There is a lost and found case near the dining hall. If you lose something, you can put a lost notice with your name and phone number on the bulletin board. It can help you find your lost items. All in all, I love my school. (1) 题目内容: Which of the following is NOT mentioned in the passage? 选项: A. The school library B. The dining hall C. The lost and found case D. The sports hall (2) 题目内容: What does the underlined word "it" refer to in Paragraph 5? 选项: A. The lost notice B. The lost and found case C. The dining hall D. The bulletin board (3) 题目内容: Who can help you if you can't find the book in the school library? 选项: A. Your friends B. The teachers there C. The computer D. Your parents (4) 题目内容: What is the best title for the passage? 选项: A. My Favorite Building B. My Classmates C. My New Teachers D. My School
ques_analyze:
本文是爱丽丝对她学校的介绍。具体答案分析如下：
(1) 细节理解题。文中提到学校图书馆、餐厅和失物招领处（失物招领处），但没有提到体育馆（sports hall），因此D选项正确。
(2) 细节理解题。文中划线单词“它”指的是可以帮助找回失物的“寻物启事”（lost notice），因此A选项正确。
(3) 细节理解题。如果在图书馆找不到书，建议向图书馆的老师求助，因此B选项正确。
(4) 最佳标题题。文章主要介绍了学校的设施，并总结出爱丽丝对学校的热爱，因此D选项最贴切。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容:    Hello, I’m Peter. I like to play basketball and I can speak English. I can also play football very well. Hi, I’m Mary and I come from the USA. I can play Ping-Pong and chess. I like to talk and play games with people. My name’s Kate. I’m in the school music club. I can play the guitar. I can sing and dance, too. I’m Jim, a boy from England. I love animals because I think they’re our friends. I’m good at looking after dogs. (1) 题目内容: What club does Peter want to join? 选项: A. the music club B. the animal club C. the football club D. the chess club (2) 题目内容: Who is from the USA? 选项: A. Mary B. Peter C. Kate D. England (3) 题目内容: Why does Jim like animals? 选项: A. because he likes to talk and play games with them B. because he thinks they’re our friends C. because he likes singing and dancing D. because he is from England
ques_analyze:
【分析】本文是一篇人物自我介绍的短文，通过几个人的描述了解他们的爱好和背景。
(1) 根据彼得的介绍，他喜欢打篮球并且足球踢得很好，因此可以推断他想加入足球俱乐部，选项C合适。
(2) 文中玛丽提到自己来自美国，因此可以确定她是美国人，答案为A。
(3) 吉姆在文中表明他喜欢动物是因为认为它们是我们的朋友，因此选项B准确反映了他的喜好原因。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Every week, I get an allowance of ￥30 from my parents. I usually spend my money on magazines, music, and movies. On Friday and Saturday nights, I always go to the movies with my friends. My parents say I should get a part-time job. If I get one, I will buy a new MP5 player. He Zhong, 13. I get an allowance of ￥40 every week from my parents. I also have some birthday money. I often spend my money on clothes, computer games, and snacks. If I have more money after my next birthday, I will buy a new mobile phone. My cousin Wang Ting has a new mobile phone. It’s really cool. Wang Min, 14. I get an allowance of ￥50 a week from my parents. I also walk dogs for my neighbors and get ￥30 every week. I spend some of my money on movies and books. I spend most of my money on my summer vacation. This summer I will go to Chongqing with my friend Zhu Lei. Zheng Bin, 16. (1) 题目内容: What does He Zhong usually spend his money on? 选项: A. 衣服 B. 音乐 C. 零食 D. 电脑游戏 (2) 题目内容: Who can get some birthday money? 选项: A. 王敏 B. 王婷 C. 何中 D. 郑彬 (3) 题目内容: How much money does Zheng Bin get a month? 选项: A. 约120元 B. 约160元 C. 约200元 D. 约320元
ques_analyze:
(1) 根据何中的描述，他通常花钱在杂志、音乐和电影上。选项中只有B符合音乐这一消费项目，因此正确答案是B。
(2) 在王敏的描述中，她提到“我还有一些生日钱”，这说明她会收到生日钱。因此，正确答案是A。
(3) 根据郑彬的描述，他每周从父母那里得到50元零用钱，还通过遛狗每周挣30元，总共80元。一个月大约四周，所以他每月总收入约为320元，因此正确答案是D。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Wanted: English tutor (家庭教师) Do you like kids? Are you outgoing? Do you have over three years' experience as an English teacher? Do you have free time on Saturday and Sunday? I need a woman teacher for my daughter. She is twelve and she is not good at English. Your duties include: 1. Teach her English from 3:00 to 6:00 p.m. 2. Play with my daughter. 3. Tell her stories in English. Our address: Beihai Road, Garden District. If you want to know more information, please call Mrs. Yang at 82569876. (1) 题目内容: Mrs. Yang wants __ for her daughter. 选项: A. a babysitter B. a good graduate C. an English tutor D. a math tutor (2) 题目内容: As the tutor, you need to teach for __ on Saturday. 选项: A. two hours B. three hours C. a whole afternoon D. a day (3) 题目内容: If you want to be the tutor, you need to __. ①be beautiful ②have over three years' teaching experience ③have time on weekends ④be a woman teacher 选项: A. ①② B. ②③ C. ①②③ D. ②③④
ques_analyze:
本文是一篇应用文，是关于招聘英语家教的广告，内容包括工作时间、地点、要求和联系方式等细节。解析如下：
(1) 根据广告的第一行提到的“寻找：英语家教”，表示需要的是一位英语家教，所以选项C是正确的。
(2) 根据广告中提供的教学时间“从下午3点到6点”，说明教学时间共计三小时，因此选项B是正确的。
(3) 广告中列明的家教要求包括：有超过三年的教学经验、周末有空且性别为女性，所以选择答案D是符合要求的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Swimming is not only good for the body, but also a great way to relax. Let’s get moving! I learned to swim this summer. I really want to play in the water, but I am afraid to go under the water. It is my first swimming lesson. My teacher is Mr. Yang. He has a big and cool swimming pool. I enjoy swimming with my teacher. He teaches me a lot about swimming. He teaches me to swim like a fish. It is interesting. I am not afraid of the water now. Swimming is healthy for us. It is cool to swim when the weather is hot. Many people think swimming is easy to learn. But it isn’t. I wanted to quit before, because it is so difficult. At last, I learned to swim and I enjoy it now. It is a good habit to swim every day, and I do it now. I want to be the second Sun Yang one day. (1) 题目内容: What does the writer think of swimming now? 选项: A. It’s hot. B. It’s easy. C. It’s boring. D. It’s healthy. (2) 题目内容: Why does the writer learn to swim? 选项: A. Because he likes Mr. Yang. B. Because he likes Sun Yang. C. Because he thinks swimming is cool. D. Because he really wants to play in the water. (3) 题目内容: Mr. Yang teaches the writer to __. 选项: A. go under the water B. swim like a fish C. play in the water D. swim in hot days (4) 题目内容: What does the underlined word “quit” in Paragraph 3 mean in Chinese? 选项: A. 放弃 B. 开始 C. 忘记 D. 坚持 (5) 题目内容: What can we learn from the passage? 选项: A. The writer has a big pool. B. Swimming is easy to learn. C. The writer swims every day now. D. The writer is afraid of water now.
ques_analyze: 首先，这篇阅读材料涉及的是作者学习游泳的经历。针对第一题，我们可以从文章第一段中得知，作者认为游泳对身体有益，因此答案选项是D，即游泳是健康的。第二题的答案可以在第一段的最后一句找到，作者表达了他开始学游泳是因为很想在水中玩耍，故正确答案为D。第三题的答案在第二段中可以找到，杨先生教作者像鱼一样游泳，此为选项B。第四题中的“放弃”一词可以通过上下文理解，作者认为游泳困难，曾经想放弃，因此其含义是选项A。最后，依据文章最后一段内容，作者坚持每天游泳，所以答案是C。整体来看，文章理解和答案选择都很明确。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: 判断对错 阅读下面的文字，并判断以下句子是否与短文内容一致。若一致写T，不一致则写F。

My name is Doris Miller. I’m 9 years old. I’m a girl. I’m from London. But now I’m in Beijing. This is my school. My Chinese teacher’s name is Li Tao. At school, I have two good friends. One is Chinese, and the other is English. My phone number is 88526230, and my e-mail address is dorismiller@yahoo.com. I want to be your friend. You can call me or send an e-mail to me.

作答类型为T/F(对/错)  
1. Doris Miller is a Chinese girl and she is 8.  
2. Doris Miller is from Beijing.  
3. Doris Miller’s Chinese teacher is Li Tao.  
4. Doris Miller has two Chinese friends in her school.  
5. You can call Doris Miller or send an e-mail to her.
ques_analyze: 1. 文章中提到Doris是一个9岁的英国女孩，因此说她是8岁的中国女孩是不正确的。
2. 文章明确表示Doris来自伦敦，而不是北京。
3. 文中直接提到Doris的中文老师名字是李涛。
4. Doris在学校有两个朋友，一个是中国人，一个是英国人，而不是两个中国朋友。
5. Doris提供了电话号码和电子邮箱，这表示你可以通过电话或邮件联系她。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Introduction It’s hard to believe that I wrote Number the Stars more than twenty years ago. It seems like yesterday that I answered the phone on a snowy January morning and received the news that it had won the 1990 Newbery Medal. I think readers of every age may match themselves with the important persons in the books they love and ask themselves: Would I have done that? What choice would I have made? And ten—the age of Annemarie in Number the Stars—is an age when young people are beginning to develop a strong set of personal ethics. They are beginning to realize that the world they live in is not always good and safe. So they follow a story about a ten-year-old girl who is caught in a dangerous situation, and she must make decisions. Young readers become cheerful when Annemarie takes a deep breath, enters the woods, faces the danger, stands up to the enemy and wins her victory. Today, the book has been published in many countries and translated into many languages. It found its way into the hands and hearts of children who had read about but never experienced war. I know books do change lives, and many readers have told me that Number the Stars changed theirs when they were young, that it made them think about both cruelty and courage. “It was something that shaped my idea of how people should be treated,” wrote a young woman recently, telling me about her own fourth-grade experience with the book. The Danish friend who first told me the story of her childhood, and who became the Annemarie in my book, is an old woman now. So am I. We both love thinking of the children reading the story today, coming to it for the first time and realizing that once, for a short time and in a small place, a group of prejudice-free people created a touching story of love and kindness towards others. Lois Lowry (1) 小说和作者的名字是什么？选项: A. Number the Stars; Lois Lowry B. Newbery Medal; Lois Lowry C. Number the Stars; Annemarie D. Newbery Medal; Annemarie (2) 以下关于安玛丽的描述哪一个是正确的？选项: A. She called a writer on a snowy January morning. B. She became cheerful after she read the book. C. She was a good friend of a Danish woman. D. She experienced many difficulties in a war. (3) 许多年轻读者告诉作者，这本书让他们思考__。选项: A. ethics and friendship B. enemy and victory C. cruelty and courage D. life and memories (4) 从这段引言中我们能了解到什么？选项: A. The book is about a story of the writer’s own child experience. B. The book is well-received and popular around the world. C. The Introduction is written in the voice of the third person. D. The Introduction is complete and we can read all of it.
ques_analyze: 【分析】本文是《星星之数》的作者洛伊丝·劳里对这本书的感悟。(1) 细节理解题。首先，关注文段中的“我写《星星之数》”来确定书的名称为《星星之数》。其次，注意到文段最后的落款是“洛伊丝·劳里”，由此可以确认作者身份。因此，答案选项为A。(2) 推理判断题。依据文段中的“年轻读者们会感到欢欣鼓舞”和安玛丽战胜危险的描述，可推知安玛丽在故事中面对危险和困难，并实现了胜利。这暗示她在战争中经历了许多挑战和困难。因此，D选项是正确的。(3) 细节理解题。根据“许多读者告诉我，《星星之数》…让他们思考残酷和勇气”，读者们被引导思考的是残酷和勇气这两个概念。因此，正确答案是C。(4) 推理判断题。文段中提到的“赢得了1990年纽伯瑞儿童文学奖”表明这本书赢得了国际奖项，这就意味着它受到了世界范围内的认可和欢迎。因此，正确的答案为B。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目描述：  
Hi, everyone! My name is Christine, and I'm from London. I'm now in Brasilia. I work with animals. I work in the evening and at night, and I sleep during the day! I get up at about 4:00 p.m. At 4:15, I have breakfast. At 5:30, I go into the forest to look for birds and write their names in my notebook. I don't talk because I don't want the birds to hear me. At 9:30, I have lunch, which is often hamburgers, but sometimes bread or rice. I finish work at about 3:00 a.m. From 3:15 to 5:00, I record all the birds' names on the computer. At 5:15, I have dinner. At 5:45, I go to bed. I sleep all day, so I don't see the sun! But this is an interesting job, and I'm very happy.  
请根据材料内容选择最佳答案。

(1) Christine在什么时间吃早餐？  
选项：  
A. 下午4:00  
B. 下午4:15  
C. 清晨5:15  
D. 傍晚5:30  

(2) Christine在森林里做什么？  
选项：  
A. 和鸟儿说话  
B. 寻找鸟儿  
C. 给鸟儿喂食  
D. 听鸟儿唱歌  

(3) Christine通常午餐吃什么？  
选项：  
A. 米饭  
B. 面包  
C. 面条  
D. 汉堡  

(4) Christine在凌晨4点做什么？  
选项：  
A. 睡觉  
B. 吃晚餐  
C. 使用电脑工作  
D. 在笔记本上写字  

(5) Christine认为她的工作如何？  
选项：  
A. 容易  
B. 无聊  
C. 困难  
D. 有趣
ques_analyze:
【分析】文章介绍了Christine的个人信息及她的工作情况。结合文章内容与选项，可以得出答案。
(1) 根据文章内容“And at 4:15 p.m. I have breakfast.”可以推断，Christine在下午4:15分吃早餐，所以选B。
(2) 文章中“I go into the forest (森林) and look for (寻找) birds.”表明Christine在森林里寻找鸟，因此答案为B。
(3) 依据文章“At 9:30 p.m. I have lunch. I often have hamburgers.”可以得知Christine午餐通常吃汉堡，选择D。
(4) 根据内容“From 3:15 a.m. to 5:00 a.m., I write the names of all the birds on the computer.”表明Christine在凌晨4点仍在用电脑工作，因此答案选C。
(5) 文章最后一句“But this is an interesting job (工作) and I'm very happy.”明确表达了Christine认为她的工作有趣，所以选D。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: 18-year-old Brennan Smith, a colorblind boy, started his custom sock business in middle school, with a small loan he got from his parents. Up till now, he has sold over $1 million worth of socks online in the last four years. Brennan thought of the idea for his custom sock company at just 13 years old. He was attending a high school basketball game in his hometown of Sherwood, Oregon, and noticed that many kids of his age were wearing the same white Nike sport socks. The boy told himself that if these white plain socks were so popular with kids, then some cool custom designs would surely be an even greater hit. However, the boy didn't tell his parents about the business idea at once. He spent six months researching and drawing up a business plan. When he had everything planned out, he asked his parents for a loan. "They thought the idea was a little out there," Brennan recently told CNN Money, but he kept pushing, and at last received a $3,000 loan to start his company. Then he began to work on his own designs. The fact that he was colorblind didn't stop him and he has created over 200 designs now. Business was slow the first year, but then Brennan started pushing his HoopSwagg products heavily on the Internet. Orders soon started coming in large numbers, and HoopSwagg became a popular brand among custom sock lovers. Right now, his designs can be found on HoopSwagg website, Amazon, and eBay. Four years after starting his business, Brennan has achieved great success while balancing school, housework, and social life. And he says he loved every minute of it. (1) 题目内容: The writing purpose of this passage is __. 选项: A. 告诉我们如何创业 B. 介绍一个色盲男孩的商业故事 C. 鼓励我们尽早计划创办公司 D. 描述一种流行的袜子 (2) 题目内容: 以下哪项显示了正确的顺序? a. Brennan从父母那里得到了一小笔贷款 b. Brennan进行了研究并制定了商业计划 c. Brennan在过去几年中赚取了超过100万美元 d. Brennan在互联网上推广他的袜子 选项: A. b a d c B. a b d c C. d a b c D. b d a c (3) 题目内容: 从文章中可以推断出Brennan __. 选项: A. 没有得到父母的支持 B. 忙得无暇做家务 C. 因为眼睛而停止设计 D. 喜爱他的学习和商业
ques_analyze: (1) 这是一个主旨大意题。文章开头提到一个色盲男孩在中学时开始了他的定制袜子生意，并从父母那里得到一小笔贷款，随后整篇文章围绕这个色盲男孩的创业故事展开。因此，文章的写作目的是介绍一个色盲男孩的创业故事，选项B最为符合。\n(2) 这是一个细节理解题。根据原文内容，Brennan首先花了六个月研究并制定商业计划，然后从父母那里获得了贷款，接着在互联网上推广他的HoopSwagg产品，并且在过去的四年中销售了价值超过一百万美元的袜子。顺序上，制定商业计划先于从父母那里得到贷款，然后是在互联网上推广产品，最后是销售额达到一百万美元。因此，选项A展示了正确的顺序。\n(3) 这是一个推理判断题。文章最后一段提到Brennan在平衡学业、家务和社交生活的同时取得了巨大的成功，并且他说他喜欢这一切的每一分钟。由此可以推断出，他不仅热爱学习，也热爱他的事业。因此，选项D是正确的。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Zhang Yang has a small family. His father is a doctor in a big hospital. He usually works from Monday to Friday. Sometimes he also works on Saturday morning. His mother is a science teacher. Her lessons are interesting and her students like her a lot. At home, she often talks with her students on the Internet. Zhang Yang’s parents love their jobs. Zhang Yang and his sister are students. His sister is good at drawing animals, such as cats and monkeys. And there are many animal pictures on the walls of her room. Zhang Yang likes basketball. He often plays it with his classmates after school. Now it’s half past eight on Sunday morning. The family are getting ready for their trip to the zoo. They enjoy sharing their time. (1) 题目内容: Where does Zhang Yang’s father work? 选项: A. 动物园. B. 学校. C. 医院. D. 剧院. (2) 题目内容: What does Zhang Yang’s mother teach? 选项: A. 信息技术. B. 地理. C. 物理. D. 科学. (3) 题目内容: What is Zhang Yang’s sister good at drawing? 选项: A. 动物. B. 花. C. 房子. D. 人物. (4) 题目内容: Who does Zhang Yang often play basketball with after school? 选项: A. 妹妹. B. 表兄. C. 父母. D. 同学. (5) 题目内容: How many people are there in Zhang Yang’s family? 选项: A. 两人. B. 三人. C. 四人. D. 五人.
ques_analyze: 【分析】本文是描述文，介绍了张扬一家四口人的日常生活和工作情况。 (1) 根据文中 '他的父亲是大医院里的医生' 可以知道张扬的父亲在医院工作，因此选择C。 (2) 根据 '他的母亲教科学课' 可以知道张扬的母亲是科学教师，所以选择D。 (3) 由 '他的妹妹擅长画动物' 可以判断张扬的妹妹擅长画动物，因此选择A。 (4) 文中提到 '放学后张扬经常和同学打球'，由此可知张扬放学后常和同学打篮球，答案为D。 (5) 通过整篇文章可以知道张扬家有父亲、母亲、妹妹和张扬本人，一共四个人，选择C。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: There are two children in my family. I am three years younger than my sister Tova, and I think everything she does is great. When I was a kid, I liked to go after her and her friends, hoping to become one of them, but there wasn’t much room for a troublesome sister. Over time, there is a distance between us although we live in the same house. So when she tells me she’s going to China to study, I don’t care much. But the first night after she leaves, I keep thinking that something is wrong. The house is too quiet. I feel just how different it is when she isn’t at home. I cry sadly. And I make a phone call to her. “Hello?” Her voice sounds the same as before. “Hey, Tova. It’s me, Sara. I’m just calling to tell you I love you.” My words come out quickly. I know that if I stop in the middle, I won’t finish them. “I know we aren’t as close as some sisters, but that doesn’t mean I’m not missing you.” After a long silence, she finally says, “Your voice makes me feel that you are beside me.” And before the call ends, she says very quickly, “I love you, too.” I never feel so great to have Tova as my sister. I’m hoping to see my sister back home this December. (1) 题目内容: The underlined word “distance” in Paragraph 1 probably means “__”. 选项: A. 距离 B. 交流 C. 友谊 D. 争吵 (2) 题目内容: After Tova leaves for China, __. 选项: A. Sara doesn’t care much B. Sara doesn’t want to cry C. Sara feels nothing different D. Sara thinks something is wrong (3) 题目内容: Sara calls Tova because __. 选项: A. she needs Tova’s help B. she wants to see Tova in China C. she wants to tell Tova she loves her D. she needs to know when Tova will come back
ques_analyze:
[分析] 这篇文章主要描述了作者与姐姐关系的变化以及思念之情。 

 (1) 根据第一段描述“小时候，我喜欢跟在她和朋友身后，希望能成为他们的一员，但因为我是一个麻烦的（讨厌的）妹妹，所以没多少机会。”可以理解，作者想加入姐姐和朋友的圈子，但因为太令人讨厌而未能如愿。因此，'疏远'在这里指的是作者与姐姐关系的疏离，即 '距离' 的含义。选A正确。 

 (2) 在第二段中提到“但她离开的第一个晚上，我总觉得有什么不对劲。”，说明托娃去中国后，萨拉感到有些不对劲，意识到托娃离开后的空缺。因此，答案为D。 

 (3) 在第四段中萨拉直接表达了自己的思念之情，“嘿，托娃，是我，萨拉。我打电话是想告诉你，我爱你。”所以萨拉打电话给托娃是为了告诉她她的爱意。故选C。 

 点睛：本题考查阅读理解中的词汇猜测和细节理解。考生需要理解文章的主旨，并准确捕捉文章中的关键内容，从而做出正确的选择。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: When I was six, I began learning to sing. I’ve volunteered since I was eight. My singing is <u>a cappella</u>. That is, I don’t sing with music. I used to sing for my mother’s friends, and then I started singing for fund-raisers put on by church groups, women’s clubs, and the Lions Club. I have three books of poetry and songs. A fourth is in production. I gave all of the money from the books to children’s charities. Money from my first book went to a school for deaf and blind kids. Money from the second book went to Home on the Range, a shelter for abused children, and to the Feed The Children fund for orphans in Bosnia. I visit people at a local nursing home. I get those women’s hair down, and they ask me to come by on Sundays and perform for them. I also sing for homebound hospice patients. I visit them, and I talk and sing for them. When I sing to someone who is dying and someone who is really sick, there’s a smile on that person’s face. I find that everyone needs love and that everyone can give love. That’s a really important lesson to me. Making someone happy makes you happy. Someone goes on and makes others happy, and it’s like a chain. (1) 题目内容: What do the underlined words “a cappella” mean? 选项: A. 和别人一起唱歌。 B. 有音乐伴奏地演唱。 C. 无音乐伴奏地演唱。 D. 独自一人唱歌。 (2) 题目内容: How does the author make money? 选项: A. 她通过写书挣得收入。 B. 她通过唱歌挣钱。 C. 她通过当医生挣钱。 D. 她通过跳舞挣钱。 (3) 题目内容: What do people think of the author’s singing? 选项: A. 他们不喜欢她的唱歌。 B. 他们喜欢听她唱歌。 C. 他们需要她的钱而不是她的歌。 D. 他们试图享受她的歌但总是失败。 (4) 题目内容: What does the author learn from her voluntary work? 选项: A. 每个人都应该给予爱但可能不需要爱。 B. 每个人都能得到爱而不需要付出爱。 C. 每个人都需要爱并且每个人都可以给予爱。 D. 让自己快乐是最重要的。
ques_analyze:
解析：
1. 词义猜测题。a cappella 是一个音乐术语，这个词在文中被明确解释为“我不伴随乐器演唱”，因此选项C：无音乐伴奏地演唱是正确的。
2. 细节理解题。根据文章提到的“我把书籍的全部收入都捐给了儿童慈善机构”，可知作者通过出版书籍获得收入，因此答案为A：她通过写书挣得收入。
3. 细节理解题。文中说到作者为临终和病重的人唱歌时总能使他们露出笑容，这表明听众喜欢听她唱歌，因此答案为B：他们喜欢听她唱歌。
4. 主旨大意题。文章最后一段总结了作者的感悟“每个人都需要爱，每个人也都可以给予爱”，这恰好是对应选项C的内容。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: When I was in primary school, Miss Green told us a story in an English class. Through the story, she wanted to tell us that there is always a solution to every problem. I kept that in mind. One day, when I returned home, I found that my father was unhappy. When I asked him why, he told me that he lost his watch when he was working in the garden. He had looked for it everywhere but couldn’t find it. He had also asked my two elder brothers to help, but they failed too. That watch was very important to my father because it was a gift from my late grandfather. “Don’t worry, Dad. I’ll help you find it,” I said. But my father didn’t believe it. After all, they all had failed to find it. He said, “Well, if you find it, I’ll give you 20 dollars.” “OK, just wait,” I said and then went to the garden. Suddenly, I thought of the story that Miss Green had told us. But how could I find the watch? I started thinking and thinking. Then I remembered that the watch ticked. But the ticking was hard to hear. I decided not to look here and there as they did. Instead, I put my ear on the ground. And ten minutes later, I found the watch. My father and brothers couldn’t believe their eyes. They thought I was really lucky. I shook my head, saying, “No. It wasn’t good luck. I just thought before I took action.” There is always a solution to every problem. Just think before you take action. (1) 题目内容: Why was the watch important to the writer’s father? 选项: A. Because it was very expensive. B. Because he had only one watch. C. Because he had used it for many years. D. Because it was a gift from his late father. (2) 题目内容: How did the writer find the watch? 选项: A. By asking his brothers for help. B. By looking here and there. C. By making some sound. D. By listening carefully. (3) 题目内容: What does the writer want to tell us in the passage? 选项: A. Think and find a solution to the problem. B. Help our family when they have problems. C. Use the things we’ve learned. D. Listen carefully at times.
ques_analyze: [分析] 本文是一篇叙事性文章，通过作者在小学时期从老师那里学习到的故事，来讲述他帮助父亲找回遗失手表的经历。 1. 根据文中的第三段，“那块手表对父亲来说非常重要，因为它是已故祖父送给他的礼物。”可以得知手表对作者的父亲非常重要，因为那是他已故父亲送给他的礼物，选择D。 2. 通过第四段的描述，作者没有随处乱找，而是利用了手表的滴答声，“于是我把耳朵贴在地上。十分钟后，我找到了手表。”因此可以明白，作者是通过仔细听来找到手表的，选择D。 3. 最后一段强调了一个道理：“每个问题都有解决办法。只要在行动前先思考。”表明在行动前思考可以找到问题的解决方法，这是作者想传达的主旨，选择A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: You are watching a film in which two people are having a fight. They hit each other hard. At the start, they only fight with their fists. But soon they begin hitting each other over the heads with chairs. And so it goes on until one of them crashes through a window and falls thirty feet to the ground below. He is dead! Of course, he isn’t really dead. With any luck, he isn’t even hurt. Why? Because the men who fall out of high windows or jump from fast-moving trains are professionals. They do this for a living. These people are called stunt performers. That is to say, they perform tricks. There are two sides to their work. They actually do most of the things you see on the screen. For example, they fall from a high building. However, they do not fall onto hard ground but onto empty cardboard boxes covered with a mattress. Again, when they hit one another with chairs, the chairs are made of soft wood and when they crash through windows, the glass is made of sugar! But although their work depends on tricks of this sort, it also requires a high degree of skill and training. Often a stunt performer's success depends on careful timing. For example, when he is “blown up” in a battle scene, he has to jump out of the way of the explosion just at the right moment. Naturally, stunt performers are well paid for their work, but they lead dangerous lives. They often get seriously injured, and sometimes killed. A Norwegian stunt performer, for example, skied over the edge of a cliff a thousand feet high. His parachute failed to open, and he was killed. In spite of all the risks, this is no longer a profession for men only. Men no longer dress up as women when actresses have to perform some dangerous actions. For nowadays, there are stuntwomen too! (1) 题目内容: Stunt performers are those who __. 选项: A. often dress up as actors B. prefer to lead dangerous lives C. often perform seemingly dangerous actions D. often fight each other for their lives (2) 题目内容: Stunt performers earn their living by __. 选项: A. playing their dirty tricks B. selling their special skills C. jumping out of high windows D. jumping from fast-moving trains (3) 题目内容: When a stunt performer falls from a high building, __. 选项: A. he needs little protection B. he will be covered with a mattress C. his life is unprotected D. his safety is generally all right (4) 题目内容: Which of the following is the main factor of successful performance? 选项: A. Strength. B. Exactness. C. Speed. D. Carefulness.
ques_analyze:
本文主要讲述了特技替身演员的工作内容和所面临的危险。
(1) 题目解析: 需要从文中找出与特技演员相关的行为。文中明确指出特技演员为生计而模拟执行一些危险动作，例如高空跌落或从快速列车上跳落。因此选择C：经常执行看似危险的动作。
(2) 题目解析: 了解特技演员如何赚取生计。他们需要通过高技能和训练来完成特技动作，所以他们是通过销售他们的特殊技能为生。因此选项B是正确的。
(3) 题目解析: 探究特技演员从高楼落下时的安全措施。文中提及，他们落在由床垫覆盖的空纸箱上，使用的椅子是软木头制成的，撞破的窗户是糖做的，这些都暗示他们有相应的安全保障措施。所以选择D：他们的安全通常是得到保障的。
(4) 题目解析: 分析成功特技表演的关键因素。文中指出成功的关键在于精确的时间控制，特技演员必须在爆炸中正确的时刻跳开。因此，B选项'精确性'(Exactness)是正确答案。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 试题内容: It was a beautiful summer morning. In the warm and bright sunlight, a bus was running along a back road in the south. There was a thin old man sitting on one seat. He was wearing a black suit. In his hands were a bunch of fresh flowers—lovely white roses with blue forget-me-nots on them. From time to time, the sun would shine on the flowers through the bus windows. Beside the man was a young girl. Her eyes came back again and again to the old man’s flowers. The time came for the old man to get off the bus. As he stood up, he placed the flowers on the girl’s lap. “I can see you love these flowers,” he said with a kind smile on his face. “And I think my wife would like for you to have them. I’ll tell her I gave them to you. If she knows that, she will be happy.” The girl accepted the flowers thankfully. Then she watched the old man get off the bus and walk through the gate of a small cemetery. (1) 试题内容: Why did the girl look at the flowers again and again? 选项: A. Because the flowers were shiny. B. Because she loved the flowers. C. Because the flowers were on her seat. D. Because white roses were expensive. (2) 试题内容: When the old man gave the flowers to the girl, he might feel __. 选项: A. angry B. sad C. good D. thankful (3) 试题内容: From the story, we know that __. 选项: A. the old man’s wife was also a kind person B. the old man didn’t love his wife anymore C. the girl didn’t want to take the flowers D. the girl followed the old man to the cemetery
ques_analyze: 细节理解题与判断推理题结合。通过阅读与分析故事内容，我们得出：(1) 女孩之所以一次又一次地看那些花，是因为她很喜欢那些花，这可以从老人脸上善意的微笑时说的话推断出来，他说：‘我看得出你很喜欢这些花。’因此选项B正确。这一点体现了女孩对花的喜爱。 (2) 当老人将花送给女孩时，他的脸上挂着善意的微笑，并说：‘我想我的妻子也希望你能拥有它们。如果她知道，她会很开心的。’这表明他认为他的妻子也会希望女孩得到这些花，这让他感觉好，由此选项C正确。 (3) 通过老人的话我们知道，他认为如果他将花交给女孩，他的妻子也会感到快乐，由此我们可以推断出老人的妻子是一个善良的人，因此选项A正确。这体现了老人对妻子的理解，以及她的善良特质。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Sharing wallDear readers, Where do you usually read books? Please share your ideas. Thank you!Reading clubIn a tree. Perhaps it seems a little strange. But for me, it’s really a good place. You can listen to the singing of birds and the green leaves around make you peaceful. —DavidAt home. “East or west, home is the best.” Home is the warmest place in the world. You can lie on the sofa or just sit on the floor. Quietly, you can enjoy reading books, like talking with good friends. —AnnaIn the reading club. After reading a good book, maybe you can’t wait to share it with your friends. It’s really amazing to talk about a good book. Everyone has his own ideas about the book. You can learn more by sharing. —PeterIn a coffee shop. The taste of coffee smells so nice! On sunny days, you can enjoy the sunshine through the window. On rainy days, you can listen to the sound of rain. Also, you can watch different people pass by. They may walk into your book and become part of it. —Linda根据文章内容，选择正确答案。 (1) 题目内容: The passage is mainly about __.选项: A. how to borrow books B. how to share books C. how to make friends D. where to read books (2) 题目内容: You can most probably see the sharing wall __.选项: A. in the reading club B. at home C. in a coffee shop D. in a tree (3) 题目内容: Who thinks a coffee shop is a good place to read books?选项: A. Anna B. Linda C. David D. Peter (4) 题目内容: Anna likes reading at home because she can __.选项: A. listen to the singing of birds B. enjoy the sunshine or the sound of rain C. talk about good books after reading them D. lie on the sofa or sit on the floor (5) 题目内容: Which of the following is NOT mentioned?选项: A. Peter thinks he can learn more by sharing a good book. B. Anna enjoys reading at home. C. David thinks the reading club is the best place to read books. D. Home is the warmest place in the world.
ques_analyze: 【分析】文章主要是四位读者分享他们最喜欢的阅读地点及原因。 (1) 主旨大意题。通过阅读共享墙的提示语“你们通常在哪里看书呢？请分享你们的想法。”，可以判定文章旨在询问读者通常阅读的地点。选项D“在哪里看书”直接对应了文章的中心内容。 (2) 推理判断题。共享墙的留言署名为“读书俱乐部”，表明读书俱乐部发起了阅读地点分享活动，因此最有可能在读书俱乐部看到共享墙。 (3) 细节理解题。Linda的分享文本出现在右下角方框内，说明她认为咖啡馆是阅读书籍的理想地点。 (4) 细节理解题。Anna的分享说明她在家阅读时能够躺在沙发上或坐在地板上，由此可知她喜欢在家阅读的舒适性。 (5) 细节理解题。文中提到David最喜欢在树上读书，并没有说读书俱乐部是他认为的最佳地点，因此C选项的内容未在文中提及。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: This is the eighth book of One Story A Day, a series of twelve books with one book for each month of the year. The stories, style, and structure of each book encourage children to read and think. There is also a CD for free recorded by professional actors for each book. Written by professional Canadian writers, these books get children excited about reading. The stories are about valuable life lessons, funny tales of friendship and family, fables and legends from around the world, and stories about nature, science, and history. These books will be popular in any home or classroom where you want to develop and encourage a love of language and reading. Children can read aloud, listen, and imitate. Parents and teachers will enjoy sitting down in a quiet environment with their children, either reading aloud to them or listening to their kids read. What’s more, children will enjoy following along while listening to the CDs. One Story A Day can be used in many situations. The stories in these books bring the joy of words and reading to the ears and minds of children in their development. Sit back, relax, and discover the pleasure of reading. (1) 题目内容: Paragraph 1 is about a book in the series of twelve books for which month? 选项: A. January B. February C. July D. August (2) 题目内容: Which of the following is TRUE according to the passage? 选项: A. The books are written by professional French writers. B. The books can make children improve language by reading. C. Parents should spend money buying the CDs about the books. D. Children can only read fables and history stories in the books. (3) 题目内容: How can children enjoy One Story A Day? 选项: A. listening and reading B. writing stories C. asking and answering D. drawing pictures (4) 题目内容: Where can we find this material in the book? 选项: A. on every page B. in the middle C. at the beginning D. at the end
ques_analyze: 该文章主要介绍了一系列名为《一天一故事》的书的基本信息。对于第1个问题，从句子'This is the eighth book of One Story A Day, a series of twelve books with one book for each month of the year.' 可以推断这是《一天一故事》系列中的第八本书，对应一年中的第八个月，即八月。因此，第一段描述的是八月份的书，答案为D。对于第2个问题，我们可以从句子'These books will be popular to any home or classroom where you want to develop and encourage a love of language and reading.' 推断这些书可以帮助孩子们通过阅读提高语言能力，所以答案是B。解答第3个问题，通过'Parents and teachers will enjoy sitting down in a quiet environment with their children, either reading aloud to them or listening to their kids read.' 我们知道孩子们可以通过听和读来享受《一天一故事》，因此答案是A。对于第4个问题，根据'Sit back, relax, and discover the pleasure of reading.' 及全文内容，我们可以推断这段介绍应出现在书的开头，为读者介绍本书，故答案为C。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: My name is Lucky. I'm a good dog. I have lived with the Smiths for 3 years. There are 4 people in the family. Mr. Smith is a teacher. His class is interesting, so his students like him very much. Mrs. Smith has a clothes store. She is very busy, but she cooks a healthy breakfast for her family every day. Jenny is a nice girl. She likes English because she gets much fun from it. Look! This is her room. It’s very tidy. Her books are in the bookcase and her tapes are on the desk. I like her room. But her brother Eric is not the same. His books are everywhere. Some are on the chairs, some are under the bed. It's difficult to find them. So he always asks, "Mom, where are my books?” But he likes playing with me. He thinks I'm his good friend. I like him, too. I love my family. We are happy every day. (1) 题目内容: The students like Mr. Smith because __. 选项: A. 他的课很有趣 B. 他很健康 C. 他很忙 D. 他的课很容易 (2) 题目内容: 根据短文内容，下面哪句话是正确的？选项: A. 詹妮喜欢数学 B. 埃里克的房间很整洁 C. Lucky 和埃里克是好朋友 D. 史密斯太太有一家食品店 (3) 题目内容: 划线单词“它们”指代 __。选项: A. 椅子 B. 书 C. 父母 D. 床 (4) 题目内容: 本文最好的标题是 __。选项: A. 一只好狗 B. 一个整洁的女孩 C. 一个快乐的家庭 D. 好朋友
ques_analyze: 这是一篇说明文，主要描述了史密斯家庭的快乐生活。以下是针对每道题的解析：(1) 学生们喜欢史密斯先生是因为他的课很有趣（His class is interesting）；(2) 文章中提到，Lucky和埃里克是好朋友（He thinks I'm his good friend）；(3) 根据上文描述，埃里克的书到处都是，有些在椅子上，有些在床下（His books are everywhere. Some are on the chairs, some are under the bed.），所以'它们'指的是书（books）；(4) 全文介绍了史密斯家庭的幸福生活，所以最合适的标题是'一个快乐的家庭'。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Summer vacation is coming. Don’t know what books to buy for your kids? Here they are: Alfie’s Angels Author: Henriette Barkow Ages: 8-9 Pictures by Sarah Garson Alfie wants to be an angel because angels can do everything! But his teacher has other ideas. She thinks Alfie just wants to look cool. Price: £7.50 Size: 21.5cmx27cm Languages: English and French That’s My Mum Author: Henriette Barkow Ages: 8-12 Pictures by Derek Brazeil People often think that Mia’s mum is not her mother because they don’t look alike. Mia and her friend Kai decide to do something about this. Price: £6.50 Size: 21.5cmx27cm Languages: English and Chinese What Is Peace Author: Emma Damon Ages: 4-6 Pictures by Helen Oxenbury Peace is giving...not taking. Peace is love...not hate. And peace is many more things... Price: £5.99 Size: 19cmx21cm Languages: English and Chinese Farmer Duck Author: Martin Waddell Ages: 6-8 Pictures by Helen Oxenbury There was a duck. It lived with a lazy farmer. While the duck worked, the farmer lay in bed. One day the other animals decided to do something for the duck. Price: £8.50 Size: 28cmx23cm Languages: English and Russian (1) 这本书适合10岁的中国孩子阅读：选项: A. Alfie’s Angels B. That’s My Mum C. What Is Peace D. Farmer Duck (2) 用£13可以买到哪些书？选项: A. What Is Peace and Farmer Duck B. Farmer Duck and Alfie’s Angels C. Alfie’s Angels and That’s My Mum D. That’s My Mum and What Is Peace (3) 这篇文本最可能是写给 __。选项: A. 农夫 B. 父母 C. 老板 D. 记者
ques_analyze:
短文主要介绍四本儿童书籍的广告，这些书提供了作者、推荐阅读年龄、插画作者、价格、书的尺寸以及语言版本的信息。
(1) 细节理解题。选择适合10岁中国孩子的书时，应关注年龄推荐和语言版本。《那是我的妈妈》适合8-12岁的孩子阅读，并且包含中文和英文版本，因此适合10岁中国孩子。故选B。
(2) 推理判断题。计算两个总价不超过£13的书。《那是我的妈妈》价格为£6.50，加上《和平是什么》价格£5.99，总共是£12.49，在预算之内。故选D。
(3) 推理判断题。通过分析文本，尤其是开头部分“不知道该买什么书给孩子吗？这里有推荐”，可以推断出文章是为父母选择孩子读物提供建议的。故选B。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: In a small town named Run Run Town, everybody likes to run fast. They run and run, and "Wham!"—it is unavoidable that they will knock into each other. So begins the Chinese picture book Run Run Town, written by Yadong and illustrated by Maike. What happens after every crash is a playful rendition of the idea of "combination" (joining things together), which, as the author points out, is important in everything from the beginning of life to written language, human imagination, science discoveries, and inventions. Some of the "combinations" in the picture book are really fun. A lady knocks into a dolphin. Guess what we get? A mermaid! In Run Run Town, even mountains are restless and don't like to stay still. When a fire-breathing dragon knocks into a walking mountain, a volcano is born. Some of the "combinations" come from Chinese language and culture. Why would the crash of a cat and an eagle produce an owl? Because in the Chinese language, "owl" is "mao tou ying" or "cat-headed eagle." Steamed bread and meatballs knock into each other, and delicious steamed buns are ready to be served. Other "combinations" are based on science. A spot of blue and a spot of yellow rush to each other and create a spot of green, reminding us of Little Blue and Little Yellow by Leo Lionni. A young man and a young woman run towards each other, and, on the last page of the book, a happy nuclear family of three is born. What would you imagine if you are asked to add a picture or two to the book? When I tried to answer the question myself, I found it difficult to come up with impressive invention ideas. So instead, I will share a creature I have found elsewhere. The Classic of Mountains and Seas, a Chinese classic book that first appeared as early as the fourth century BC, describes imaginary beings, gods, and deities. There is a Chinese version of a "mermaid" in The Classic of Mountains and Seas: people in a country called "Diren" are described as having human faces, the bodies of fish, and no feet. Next time when you see those magical beings in Run Run Town, you will be able to understand how they come to be. (1) 题目内容: What may happen when two objects run into each other in Run Run Town? 选项: B. They find out science facts. A. Something new is created. C. They fight against each other. D. A new language is discovered. (2) 题目内容: According to the passage, which idea probably comes from Chinese language? 选项: A. A star rushes into a fish and a starfish is born. C. The crash of wheels and a building creates a train. B. When a bear knocks into a cat, a panda is born. D. Yadong and Maike run into each other and create Run Run Town. (3) 题目内容: What's the purpose of mentioning The Classic of Mountains and Seas in the passage? 选项: A. To teach readers how to draw pictures. B. To encourage readers to read this book. C. To help complete the book Run Run Town. D. To show one more way of imagining combinations. (4) 题目内容: What is the passage mainly about? 选项: A. The ways to create new ideas. C. The history of picture books in China. B. Strange creatures around the world. D. An introduction to a Chinese picture book.
ques_analyze: 本文是一篇说明文，涉及了一本充满想象力的中国图画书《Run Run Town》。1）问题考察阅读理解的细节，文中提到：“每次碰撞后的结果是对‘组合’这个概念的有趣演绎”，即事物相撞后会组合在一起创造出新物，因此正确答案为A。2）结合中文语境理解的题目，文中解释了为什么猫和鹰相撞会产生猫头鹰，因为‘猫头鹰’在中文里是‘猫头鹰’。所以‘熊+猫’在中文语境中联想到‘熊猫’，答案为B。3）发散思维与想象力的题目，在难以构思新颖创意时，作者选择分享《山海经》中的生物来展示想象力的另一种组合方式，即创意可以来自古典文学，故选项D正确。4）全文综述的问题，主要介绍了这本富有创意和组合想象力的图画书，故选项D正确。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content:
题目内容: How old is John? 选项: A. 13 B. 12 C. 10 D. 11

(2) 题目内容: How many students are there in Miss Wang’s class? 选项: A. 10 B. 24 C. 20 D. 14

(3) 题目内容: What does the underlined word “画家” mean? 选项: A. 医生 B. 作家 C. 画家 D. 音乐家

(4) 题目内容: Which statement about John is correct? 选项: A. John doesn’t like English classes B. John is not Mike’s friend C. John is a student at Guangming Middle School D. John and Mike are in the same class

(5) 题目内容: Which statement is true? 选项: A. Miss Zhang is John’s teacher B. Mike’s English is good C. John is in Class Two D. Mike is 12 years old
ques_analyze:
【分析】这篇文章主要介绍了John的个人信息、学校情况以及他的朋友。
(1) 细节理解题。文章直接提到“我今年12岁”，所以John的年龄是12岁，正确答案是B。
(2) 细节理解题。通过句子“班上有10个男生和10个女生”可知，班里总共有20名学生，正确答案为C。
(3) 词义猜测题。根据“He likes to draw” (喜欢画画) 和“wants to be a painter” (想成为画家) 可以推测出“画家”在中文中是画家，正确答案是C。
(4) 细节理解题。通过“John是光明中学的学生”可以推断C选项是正确的。
(5) 细节理解题。根据“他的英语很好”可以确定B选项的陈述是正确的，因此答案是B。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: There are several ways you can find out about the countries and places you wish to visit. You can talk to friends who have travelled to those places, you can watch related movies, or you can read travel books. There seem to be three types of travel books. The first type consists of books that give personal, subjective accounts based on the authors' own travel experiences. These books can be useful if the authors are willing to share their travel experiences. The second type provides purely objective information about things to do and sights to see. If written by a cultured person, these books can be even more practical. The third type is known as a "guide" to a place. If they are of good quality, they will describe and explain the place in detail, and I think they are the most helpful for travelers. Like the first type, they can also be exciting and interesting, but their main purpose is to help the reader plan their travel in the most special way. Whatever kind of travel book you choose, you must make sure that it does not describe everything as "wonderful," "excellent," or "fantastic." You must pay attention to its date of publication because travel is a very practical matter, and many things change quickly in the twenty-first century. Finally, you should ensure that it is easy to find the practical information you need. (1) 题目内容: The writer of the first kind of travel book gave his ideas after he __. 选项: A. travelled B. read books C. heard a lot about travelling D. surfed the Internet (2) 题目内容: The underlined phrase “a cultured person” means a person with __. 选项: A. a good appearance B. a good education C. a lot of experience D. a lot of money (3) 题目内容: The date of publication must be noticed because __. 选项: A. the prices of travel books may be different B. the writers of travel books may be different C. the information in travel books is always the same D. the information in travel books is always changing (4) 题目内容: According to the passage, it is best to read __ before travelling to a place of interest. 选项: A. the first kind of travel book B. the second kind of travel book C. the third kind of travel book D. some travel articles in newspapers
ques_analyze: 在分析第一种书的功能时，我们了解到这类书是基于作者自己旅行之后的个人经历和感受创作的（The first are those that give a personal, subjective ideas of travels which the writers have got themselves.）。如果作者是一个有文化素养的人，第二种书就更有用（If a cultured person has written such a book, then it is even more useful.）可得出‘a cultured person’意味着有良好教育背景的人。对于出版日期的关注，小文中提到在21世纪，旅游信息变化很快，因此信息会迅速过时（You must keep an open eye on its date of publication because travel is a very practical matter and many things change quickly in the twenty-first century.）。作者建议选择第三种被称为“旅游指南”的书籍，因为它们对旅行者有详细的描述和解释，帮助旅行者进行详细的旅行规划（The third kind are those books which are called 'a guide' to some place. If they are good, they will describe and explain the place in detail.）。考点是对作者观点的细节理解以及对词义的猜测，我们需要根据文章信息来选择正确答案。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Do you know Alice in Wonderland has its origin in Oxford, England? One afternoon in July 1862, Charles Dodgson, an Oxford teacher, took the 10-year-old Alice Liddell and her sisters on a boating picnic up the River Thames. To make the children happy, he made up a story about an adventure of a girl called Alice. Alice Liddell loved the story so much that she asked Charles to write it down. Under the name of Lewis Carroll, he created Alice in Wonderland. The story later became a favourite of children all over the world. With Alice’s origin in Oxford, the city celebrates Alice’s Day in July each year. Colourful events and activities including the Mad Tea Party, the Caucus Race and much more are held for tourists. People can create their own adventures by following a special route across the city. They can stop off along the way to try “Eat me biscuits”, meet the Queen of Hearts and discover hidden treasures. There is also an Alice’s Shop with the number 83 on its red door. In front of it stands the White Rabbit. Tourists will find him look worriedly at his pocket watch and say “Oh dear! Oh dear! I shall be too late!” (1) 本段主要介绍了____。选项: A. Charles Dodgson, Alice Liddell and her sisters’ adventure B. how the book Alice in Wonderland had its origin C. a boating picnic up the River Thames D. why the story Alice in Wonderland became popular around the world (2) 为什么牛津城要庆祝爱丽丝节？选项: A. Because the writer of Alice in Wonderland was born in Oxford. B. Because Alice in Wonderland has its origin in Oxford. C. Because the owner of Alice Shop lives in Oxford. D. Because there is an Alice’s Shop in Oxford. (3) 《爱丽丝梦游仙境》的作者的真名是什么？选项: A. Charles Carroll. B. Alice Liddell. C. Lewis Carroll. D. Charles Dodgson (4) 为什么站在爱丽丝商店门前的兔子看起来很焦虑？选项: A. He can’t find his pocket watch. B. He has lost his book. C. He is afraid of being caught. D. He is afraid of being late. (5) 以下哪句是不正确的？选项: A. Alice Liddell was ten years old in 1862. B. The writer of Alice in Wonderland was an artist. C. Alice in Wonderland is a favourite of children from all over the world. D. The story of Alice in Wonderland began in 1862.
ques_analyze: 本文介绍了《爱丽丝梦游仙境》的创作背景以及在每年七月牛津举行的爱丽丝节。下面是各问题的详细解析：(1) 本段讲述的是《爱丽丝梦游仙境》的作品来源的故事，根据文中提到的'以路易斯·卡罗尔的名字，他创作了《爱丽丝梦游仙境》。'，可以判断B项(作品来源)正确。(2) 根据文中提到的'《爱丽丝梦游仙境》的起源地是牛津'和'庆祝爱丽丝节'可以确定是因为《爱丽丝梦游仙境》起源于牛津，选择B项。(3) 文中提到'查尔斯·道奇森，是牛津的一位教师'并且后文说明了由查尔斯·道奇森所创作，因此作者的真实名字是查尔斯·道奇森，因此选择D项。(4) 根据文中的描述，游客可以看到兔子在急切地看着他的怀表说'我要迟到了!'，显示了它担心会迟到，所以选择D项。(5) 根据文章信息，作者查尔斯·道奇森是一位教师，并未提到他是艺术家，故选B项。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Hello, I'm Sam. Here is a photo of my family. It's a nice photo. Who is the old man in the photo? He is my father's father, Ben. Smith is his last name. He is retired now, so he has much time to play with me. And who is she? She is my grandmother, Helen. These are my parents Paul and Jane. I love my dad and mom. This is my father's sister, Betty. She is a teacher. And this is Betty's husband, my uncle Jerry. He is a teacher, too. These two girls are my sister Sally and my cousin Cindy. They are good students in school. Oh, who is he? It's me. I have a big family. I love my family. （1）题目内容：What's Paul's last name? 选项： A. Smith. B. Clark. C. Jerry. D. Henry. （2）题目内容：What does the underlined word 'retired' mean in Chinese? 选项： A. 生病的 B. 年轻的 C. 退休的 D. 害怕的 （3）题目内容：The underlined word 'they' refers to __. 选项： A. Betty and Jerry B. Paul and Jane C. Sally and Cindy D. Barry and Helen （4）题目内容：Which is RIGHT about Sam? 选项： A. He has three cousins. B. His parents are teachers. C. Jerry is his brother. D. He has a sister.
ques_analyze:
"【分析】这是一张关于山姆家庭照片的描述。
(1) 细节理解题。照片描述中提到，老人的姓是史密斯，他是山姆的祖父，进一步提到山姆的父亲名叫保罗，因此保罗的姓也是史密斯。
(2) 词义猜测题。从‘他现在退休了，所以他有很多时间跟我玩’这句话可以推测出，'退休'的意思是‘退休的’。
(3) 词义猜测题。根据描述，这两个女孩分别是山姆的妹妹莎莉和表妹辛迪，因此‘她们’指的是莎莉和辛迪。
(4) 推理判断题。山姆提到自己的妹妹莎莉，说明他有一个妹妹。"

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Children's Games in Ancient China In ancient times, people had limited material resources, especially for children's playthings. However, they still created interesting games for entertainment. Kicking stone balls During the Qing Dynasty, kicking a stone ball was a popular game in the northern part of China, especially played in winter to keep warm. Playing hide-and-seek Hide-and-seek is a traditional game for children, popular nationwide. There are two common ways to play: one is to cover a child's eyes while other kids run around to tease him; the other, more common way is for others to hide and one child to seek them. Flying kites Kites have a long history. The earliest kites were made of wood, not paper. The Beijing kite, Tianjin kite, and Weifang kite are the three most famous kites, each with its own unique feature. For example, the bird-shaped kite with long wings is a special type of Beijing kite. Watching shadow plays In ancient times, watching a shadow play was the closest thing to watching a film. Artists controlled puppets behind the screen and told stories to the accompaniment of music. (1) 题目内容: 根据文章内容，踢石球这项游戏在__。选项: A. 在夏季玩 B. 类似于放风筝 C. 在北京发明 D. 在中国北方流行 (2) 题目内容: 捉迷藏通常是怎么玩的？选项: A. 一人玩其他人看。 B. 其他人笑一个人必须哭。 C. 其他人藏起来一个人寻找。 D. 一个人跑其他人追赶。 (3) 题目内容: 文中划线单词“特征”的意思是?选项: A. 特征 B. 地貌 C. 五官 D. 影片 (4) 题目内容: 哪项古代游戏类似观看电影？选项: A. 踢石球。 B. 放风筝。 C. 捉迷藏。 D. 看影戏。 (5) 题目内容: 哪项陈述根据文章内容为真?选项: A. 踢石球通常在夏天玩。 B. 最早的风筝是用纸做的。 C. 捉迷藏有三种玩法。 D. 艺术家在屏幕后操纵木偶并伴随音乐讲述故事。
ques_analyze: 这篇短文介绍了古代中国儿童玩的一些游戏。通过阅读文本细节，我们可以确定踢石球在冬天的北方是流行的（问题1答案D）；捉迷藏通常是一人寻找其他人藏起来（问题2答案C）；文中“特征”意指每种风筝都有自己独特的特点（问题3答案A）；观看皮影戏类似于现代的看电影（问题4答案D）；最后，通过文章描述可以得出艺术家在屏幕后操作木偶并伴随音乐讲故事的描述是真实的（问题5答案D）。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Skateboarding makes me feel free, like I’m flying. When I’m in the air, it feels like I can do anything. I started skating and surfing when I was two or three. My dad built a mini-ramp in our backyard. He would skate every day after surfing. I would steal his board and play with it. If I saw my dad doing a cool trick, I’d think “I want to try that.” I’d look it up on Youku and try to learn it. Now I just learn from my friends. It’s nice to skate with your friends because you can teach each other things. I never really thought, “I’m going to get so good at this.” I just got better and better and it happened naturally when I was seven. I’m 12 now. It’s a great feeling, getting a new trick especially if it’s taken a long time to learn. You try it a thousand times and then one day, you finally land it. That’s the feeling I want. It’s what makes me keep trying new things. When I was eight, I became the first female skater to land a frontside 540. Sometimes doing a trick can be scary. But I feel like that falling is just part of skateboarding. I like inspiring other girls to do what they want to do. I don’t want girls to think that boys can do things that they can’t. I want girls to think, “I can do it, because I’m a girl. If I can do it, so can they.” Word Bank mini-ramp 小型坡道 frontside 540 滑板外转540度 trick 技巧 根据材料内容选择最佳答案。 (1) 题目内容: 滑板让作者有何感觉？选项: A. 她感到害怕。 B. 她觉得自由。 C. 她感到紧张。 D. 她的头脑集中。 (2) 题目内容: 作者最初如何学习技巧？选项: A. 她向父亲求助。 B. 她从朋友那里学的。 C. 她在网上观看视频。 D. 她在冲浪时练习技巧。 (3) 题目内容: 是什么让作者不断尝试新事物？ 选项: A. 朋友的帮助。 B. 父亲的支持。 C. 培训课程的技能。 D. 成功的感觉。 (4) 题目内容: 下列哪个词最能形容作者? 选项: A. 有才华而安静。 B. 外向且健谈。 C. 勇敢且意志坚定。 D. 体贴且善良。 (5) 题目内容: 下面哪项作为文章的标题最合适？选项: A. 翱翔天空。 B. 做一个技巧很可怕。 C. 一个职业滑手。 D. 如何变得勇敢。
ques_analyze:
本文讲述了作者通过滑板运动不断挑战自己、超越自我限制的经历。
(1) 滑板让我感觉自由，可推知作者在滑板时感到自由，故答案为B。
(2) 作者最初是通过观看优酷上的视频学习技巧的，根据'我会在优酷上查找并学习这个技巧'可以得知，故答案为C。
(3) 成功的感觉激励作者不断尝试新事物，根据'你尝试了一千次，某天终于成功了。这就是我想要的感觉'得出结论，答案为D。
(4) 有时候做一个技巧会很可怕。但我觉得摔倒只是滑板的一部分'推测出作者具有勇气和坚强的意志，故答案为C。
(5) 通过整篇文章的内容，作者通过滑板运动体验挑战和超越，'翱翔天空'作为文章标题最为贴切，体现了文章的主旨。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容:    Look! This is a photo of my family. My name is Brooklyn. I am 11 years old now. Do you know my father? Yes, he is David Beckham, a good football player. He is 39 years old now. This is my mother. Her name is Victoria. She is 36 years old now. I have a brother, but he is not in this photo. He is only 1 year old. His name is Romeo. We are very happy. (1) 题目内容: How old is my father? 选项: A. 36 B. 32 C. 39 D. 38  (2) 题目内容: __ is my mother. 选项: A. David Beckham B. Victoria C. Brooklyn D. Romeo  (3) 题目内容: — Is my brother in the photo? — __ 选项: A. No, he isn't. B. He is 1 year old. C. He is Romeo. D. Yes, he is.  (4) 题目内容: There are __ people in my family. 选项: A. 4 B. 3 C. 5 D. I don't know
ques_analyze: 下面逐题解析：(1) 根据文中 '他今年39岁' 可知答案是C。 (2) 根据文中 '她叫维多利亚' 可知答案是B。 (3) 根据文中 '但他没有在这张照片里' 可知答案是A。 (4) 根据文中提到的家庭成员数量（布鲁克林，父亲大卫·贝克汉姆，母亲维多利亚，弟弟罗密欧）总共4人，可知答案是A。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: Most experts agree that the Internet has totally changed how we read, think, and remember things. However, whether this transition has had a good or bad effect is still unknown. There is proof that we are reading fewer books, especially non-fiction. For example, if you need medical advice or cooking instructions, who wants to buy a 300-page book when you can find a 300-word article on the Internet? It’s easier to read, it’s free, and it’s a lot faster. However, we are, in fact, reading a lot more overall. In addition to our offline reading, we read online throughout the day as we check our smartphones, surf the Internet, visit social media sites, and catch up on our e-mail. We also do a lot more skimming and scanning on the Internet than we do when we read physical books or magazines and newspapers. Before there was an Internet, people spent a lot of time taking notes in libraries. Today, you can just simply bookmark any page and return to it easily. However, many argue that online information sources often have mistakes and can’t be trusted, so we need to be more careful when we use them. Some think that the Internet has made it more difficult to focus on one task because updates from social media websites and e-mail messages continually interrupt us. We follow links to other websites where we find more links to other websites and jump from topic to topic. We also get a lot of junk – for example, news about famous people and advertisements about products we don’t want or need. Some consider what we read on the Internet to be junk, while others see many advantages in the reading we do on the Internet. Some argue that reading on the Internet is like exercise for the brain, making it easier for us to deal with interruption and think clearly as we learn to make choices that work for us. In a recent study, a lot of people agreed that our use of the Internet has actually made us smarter. If you grew up with the Internet, that’s very good news, in fact. (1) 互联网如何改变了我们的阅读方式？选项: A. 它提供了更多小说供人们分享。 B. 它使人们选择文章而不是书籍。 C. 它提供了略读和扫描的机会。 D. 它使人们在日常生活中阅读更多。 (2) 互联网使专注于一个任务更难因为 __。选项: A. 有购物相关的链接连到任务。 B. 正确的信息通常隐藏在垃圾中。 C. 各种不需要的信息常常分散注意力。 D. 人们需要跟随不同的链接找到正确信息。 (3) 作者写这篇文章的主要目的是？选项: A. 质疑在线信息的来源。 B. 讨论网上阅读的问题。 C. 陈述对在线阅读的影响的意见。 D. 强调阅读非小说的重要性。 (4) 以下哪一个是这篇文章的最佳标题？选项: A. 阅读技能的塑造 B. 阅读习惯的转变 C. 干扰的缺点 D. 网上阅读的好处
ques_analyze:
(1) 这道题考查细节理解。根据文中的‘事实上，我们整体上读了更多’这一句，能够看出在日常生活中人们阅读量增加了。因此选项D正确。
(2) 这道题同样考查细节理解。根据文中的‘有些人认为互联网使我们更难以专注于一个任务，因为社交媒体网站和电子邮件消息的更新不断打断我们’和有关名人新闻以及垃圾广告的部分，能够得出大量不需要的信息扰乱了人们的注意力，因此选项C正确。
(3) 该题考查主旨大意。文章整体讨论了互联网对人们阅读方式的影响，列举了各种观点，并没有给出明确的好或坏的判断，因此选项C正确。
(4) 在最佳标题的选择上，文章开篇就讨论了网络时代人们的阅读习惯发生了转变，并在全文中持续讨论这一现象，因此‘阅读习惯的转变’是最佳标题，选项B正确。

subject: 初中英语
ques_content: 题目内容: My name is Ben. I am seven years old. I have many friends. Most of them are at my age. My best friend is Harry. He is seven. He lives near me. We go to the same school and are in the same class. We both have black hair and brown eyes, but Harry's hair is long, mine is short. Harry is quite fat. He doesn't like sports, so he doesn't get much exercise. But I like sports. I play football or go swimming every day. Harry helps me with my math homework. I help him with his English homework. We both like playing computer games. We are best friends. (1) 题目内容: What CANNOT we know from the passage? 选项: A. Ben has many friends B. Ben and Harry go to the same school C. Ben and Harry are best friends D. Ben and Harry like the same things (2) 题目内容: Where do Ben and Harry live? 选项: A. Near each other B. Far away from each other C. In the same house D. In different cities (3) 题目内容: What does Ben help Harry with? 选项: A. His math homework B. His computer games C. His English homework D.
